loans.name: Familia S. C. Group

texts.es: El grupo “Familia S. C.” está integrado por cuatro hermanos los cuales todos viven en la misma comunidad muy tranquila donde aun las personas conservan su lengua mazahua, algunos de los habitantes se dedican al cultivo de maíz pero otros son comerciantes. Leobardo tiene 44 años de edad es el representante del grupo platica que está casado desde hace 24 años con la señora María del Rosario, juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos aun dependen de dicha pareja porque aun asisten a la escuela. Leobardo es un hombre muy trabajador pero sobretodo responsable por eso desde hace 30 años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de manteles de plástico, “Es un negocio familiar desde hace varios años nuestros padres también eran comerciantes por eso mismo también decidimos tomar el mismo rumbo”. Él vende en todos los tianguis ya tiene un puesto fijo, platica que no tiene ninguna dificultad solo cuando sus ventas están bajas pero para Leobardo esto no es ningún problema para hacer crecer su negocio. Este es su mayor sueño poder engrandecer su negocio para tener otro en algún otro lugar, ahora con su crédito lo aprovechara para comprar mas productos de jarcieria y manteles de plástico, ellos están muy agradecidos con VisionFund  y KIVA por el préstamo porque será de gran ayuda para hacer crecer sus negocios para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo son Antonio quien invertira en cosmeticos, Cesareo vasos de licuadora y Mario en pasta dental.
texts.en:
The “Familia S. C.” is made up of four brothers who all live in the same peaceful community where the Mazahua language is still preserved. Some of the inhabitants cultivate corn, but others are merchants. Leobardo, the group representative, is 44. He says that he has been married to María del Rosario for 24 years. Together, they formed a family with four children, two of whom are still dependent on them because they still go to school. Leobardo is a very hard-working man, and he is, above all, responsible. He has been buying and selling plastic tablecloths for 30 years. 
"This has been a family business for several years. Our parents were also merchants, and for this reason we also decided to go into the same line of work."
Leobardo sells in all the street markets; he has a fixed stall. He says that he does not have any trouble, except when his sales are low, but this is not a problem for business growth. 
His greatest dream is to be able to expand his business in order to have another in another location. 
With this loan he will buy more fibre products and plastic table cloths.
The brothers are very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for this loan; it will be a great help for them in expanding their businesses and improving their qualities of life. 
The group members are Antonio, who will invest in cosmetics, Cesareo, who will invest in blenders, and Mario, who will invest in toothpaste.

loans.use: to buy plastic tablecloths.

location.town: San Pedro Chico, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Maribel De La Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Maribel, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de  21, 15 y 6  años que estudian en universidad, colegio y  escuela.
Doña Maribel es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, toallas entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo, trabaja en los ratos que está desocupada,   deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, sabanas y toallas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado meet in the citadel Libertad # 2 of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the true tamarinds.
Maribel, age 42, lives here. She is a single mother of three children, ages 21, 15, and 6. Her children are in university, high school, and elementary school.
Maribel is a woman who has had to work a great deal in order to get her children ahead. She is a merchant and sells all kinds of clothing, sheets, towels, and other items. She sells door-to-door and also from her home; her customers come over when they need things.
She works when she is not busy. She leaves her products with her clients on credit and charges every 15 days. 
She has been doing this work for over 10 years, so she has a very good clientele.
She will use this loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as: clothing, sheets, and towels. She has been a member of this group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets, and towels.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

Susan has a beauty salon and has been in this business for ten years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include on-and-off electricity, transportation and seasonality. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cream relaxers, braids, weaves, shampoo and Vaseline.  She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more cream relaxers, braids, weaves, shampoo and Vaseline

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
El sonido del motor del molino despierta a los vecinos de Martha. Desde tempranas horas empieza su jornada laboral atendiendo encargos pendientes. Un rico aroma a tortilla caliente engalana su vivienda lo que atrae a muchos visitantes. Su hija y esposo son un pilar esencial, porque la apoyan en el negocio. Martha se caracteriza por ser una mujer visionaria e innovadora. Por el momento se encuentra enfocada en la inversión de un nuevo proyecto.
Martha desea invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas para alquiler, asimismo, desea adquirir productos al por mayor, como el maíz, masa y otros.  Ella decidió recurrir al apoyo de KIVA Mi Crédito, con el fin de contar con el capital necesario.  Todas las ganancias serán destinadas para mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar  y por supuesto, continuará  manteniendo su negocio a flote con los ingresos que obtenga.
texts.en: The sound of the motor on a mill wakes up Martha's neighbors. She starts her working day in the wee hours of the morning, taking care of her orders. A rich odor of tortillas envelops her house which attracts a lot of visitors. Her daughter and husband are her pillars as they support her business. Martha is a far seeing and innovative woman. At the moment she is focusing on a new project. She wants to buy chairs and tables to rent out and also wants to buy wholesale products like corn, corn flour, etc. She has decided to request another loan from Kiva and MiCredito so she has the capital needed. All the profits will go to improving the infrastructure of her house and of course keeping her business afloat with her income.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to rent and to buy corn, corn flour, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Ermilia Geovannya

texts.es: Ermilia habita en su humilde casita junto a su esposo, ambos se han esforzado para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda, ella con ingresos que recibe del negocio de Cosas de Horno y él se dedica a trabajar para una empresa del estado como guarda de seguridad, con el animo de incrementar su producción necesita financiamiento para ser utilizado en compra de azúcar, maíz, leña, dulces y otros productos destinado a la elaboración de cosas de Horno; de esta manera incrementaría sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ermilia lives in a modest house along with her husband. They both have worked very hard to improve their home a little bit at a time. Ermilia earns income from selling baked goods, and her husband works for a state company as a security guard. To increase her production, Ermilia is requesting this loan to buy sugar, corn, firewood, sweets and other supplies needed for her baked goods business. She hopes to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her baked goods business, including sugar, corn, firewood and sweets.

loans.name: Lucia Lorena

texts.es: Lucia tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 7 años de edad. Lucia posee negocio de tienda la cual tiene ubicada en su hogar de habitación desde hace 3 años. Es así como junto a su compañero de vida van sacando adelante a su familia. Lucia desea construir las paredes de un cuarto y construir una pila para almacenar el agua para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar material como: cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro para dar inicio a la construcción de las paredes del cuarto y la pila lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Lucia is 26 and lives in her own home with her partner and their two children ages 7 and 13. Lucia has had a store, run out of her home, for 3 years. This is how she and her partner have gotten their family ahead. 
Lucia wants to build the walls of a room and a basin in order to save water. For this, she is requesting a loan FUSAI for the purchase of materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and iron, in order to start building the walls and basin as early as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build the walls of a room and to build a basin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her tuition and buy education equipment

loans.name: Fe Arlyn

texts.en: Fe Arlyn is 36 years old and lives in Manga,Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is single with three children. Being a single-mother, she has to work hard to provide for the needs of her children. To earn a living, Fe Arlyn has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Fe Arlyn has a requested a loan to purchase "banyeras" (big basin) of fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 months.  In the future, Fe Arlyn would like to expand her small business.

loans.use: to purchase "banyeras" (big basin) of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Marilyn has been in this business for four years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en: Eduarda is 59 years old and married with twelve children. She works very hard to provide for them. Eduarda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Eduarda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 4,300 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Eduarda is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Griselda Del Socorro

texts.es: Griselda, habita en la zona del Rama, con su actividad de pequeña ganadera que heredo de su papá ha logrado construir aunque su vivienda aunque sea de madera, cuenta también con la ayuda de su esposo quien desempeña la actividad de pequeño Ganadero y en tiempos libres repara celulares, pero aun con los ingresos de ambos no logran terminar su vivienda por lo que Griselda necesita Financiamiento para comprar madera para cambiar la estructura del techo de su vivienda que esta ya se encuentra en mal estado, pues ella pretende mejorar poco a poco hasta llegar a culminarla de concreto para cuando vengas sus hijitos tener un hogar digno donde puedan crecer en mejor ambiente.
texts.en: Griselda lives in the municipality of El Rama, where she raises cattle. She inherited this business from her father. Griselda has managed to build a wood house with the help of her husband, who works raising cattle as well but also repairs cell phones in his spare time. Even with both of their incomes, Griselda and her husband have not been able to finish their house. She is requesting this loan to buy wood to change the structure of the roof of their house, which is already in bad condition. She hopes to improve her house a little bit at a time and one day finish it with concrete, so that when she has children they will have a good home to grow up in.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Justa Pastora

texts.es: Justa Pastoras, se esfuerza por salir adelante cada dia, junto a su esposo han procreado tres hijos dos en edad universitario y el menor de 5 añitos, doña Justa se ha dedicado al comercio de productos de pulperia como Granos, Básicos, Azúcar, Jabón, Aceite, Abarroteria, y otros, de esta manera obtiene sus ingresos mientras su esposo aporta a los gastos del hogar de la actividad de compra y venta de ganado aunque no es siempre; aun con los ingresos de ambos no logran surtir su inventario de Productos por lo que necesita financiamiento y así contar con variedades en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos que tanto desea.
texts.en:
Justa Pastoras works hard to get ahead every day. Together with her husband they have 3 children, 2 of university age and the youngest is 5 years old. 

Mrs. Justa sells grocery store products like basic grains, sugar, soap, oil, grocery items and others. That is how she makes her income, while her husband provides for the household expenses through buying and selling cattle although it is not always the case. 

Even with both of their incomes they can’t stock up their product inventory which is why she needs the loan, and thus she will be able to have variety in her business and increase her earnings which she really hopes for.

loans.use: to buy grocery store products

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 48-year-old, married businesswoman who lives in Brgy. Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member in good standing with the Cooperative for five years and with no record of default. She supported her husband with her buy and sell dry goods business, and RTWs.  Recently, she borrowed money from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for the purpose of buying materials for housing renovation. She deeply wishes to live comfortably with her family in their newly renovated house.

loans.use: to buy materials for housing renovation.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. Elsie and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan of PHP 7,400 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Elsie has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. With your help, Elsie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam operates a business of selling palm leaves for thatching houses. She sells to her neighbors and house builders who come to buy from her.  With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves for resale.  She dreams to expand her business to earn more income, and establish a wholesale shop for selling palm leaves in the near future. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is fifty years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years Moses has been working hard to manage his pharmacy shop where he sells drugs, medical supplies, etc.

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs and medical equipment. Greater profits will help Moses to pay school fees and other basic needs for his family. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to make enough money to open a medical clinic.

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs and medical equipment to sell

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es: Anastacio es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Anastacio se dedica a vender pescado y necesita credito para comprar mayor cantidad de truchas para vender en los mercados de La Paz, Anastacio es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Anastacio is married, he has three children and he lives in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement, which is on land he owns. Anastacio makes a living selling fish and he needs a loan to buy a larger quantity of trout to sell in the markets in La Paz. Anastacio is the only source of income in his home, which is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy trout for his fish selling business.

loans.name: Honey Meashell

texts.en: Honey Meashell is 25 years old and lives in Manga,Tangub City. She is married with two children. She has a sari-sari store. She has had this business for nine months. She requested a loan for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She wants to buy additional inventories like canned goods, sugar, oil and noodles to sell. Honey Meashell has been a member of PMPC for nine months. In the future, she hopes to provide for her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories like canned goods, sugar, oil and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista   is widowed with five children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling cereals and has been in this business for 10 years.  She generates additional income from a pub.   

Teopista has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of cereals: beans, groundnuts, maize and sim-sim (sesame seeds).  She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked pub and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.  

Teopista decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of its timely loans. She resides in   a rented house and   the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like beans, groundnuts, maize, and sim-sim (sesame seed).

loans.name: Shahnoz

texts.en:
Shahnoz is 29 years old. She is a careful mother of two children. Shahnoz’s children are little. Her husband is a rental worker. His income is small. 

Shahnoz has been busy with a farming business for more than five years. She grows tomatoes, wheat, watermelons, etc. She sells the harvest in a local market. She develops her business, little by little. 

Shahnoz is now going to make new sowing and, with this aim, she is asking for a loan of TJS 1,500 (somoni) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She has a business, selling second-hand bras, and she has been in this business for 20 years. 

Harriet has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bales of bras. 

She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her customers reaching out to her, and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler of used bras and to start importing them. 

Harriet decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used bras.

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
Jolinda is married with three children.  She is 39 years old and lives in the Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Jolinda is a farmer and grows rice  to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan as additional capital on her farm. She wants to buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

Jolinda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to own a rice field some day.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Rancho Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Rancho Loma Bonita” (Ranch Beautiful Hill) está ubicado en una comunidad muy bonita y tranquila, en la entrada de la comunidad se puede ver el negocio de los integrantes aunque sus casas en realidad están más lejos. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron precisamente porque les gusta mucho el lugar donde viven, es decir un pequeño rancho y el lugar donde está ubicado es en una loma.

Don Adán tiene 54 años de edad está casado con la señora Guadalupe desde hace 32 años juntos formaron una familia con dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, Doña Lupita y Adán tienen una tienda de abarrotes desde hace varios años estaba ubicada en su misma casa pero no les beneficiaba para crecer porque el lugar no es muy transitado. Desde hace dos años y medio se cambiaron de lugar ahora ya están a la orilla de la carretera. “Ahora si hemos visto la mejoría en nuestra tienda de abarrotes ya tenemos más clientela por lo que nuestras ganancias han aumentado” Esta vez están solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercancía como pan, huevo, leche, refresco, azúcar, sal, etc. La tienda de Don Adán y Lupita no tiene ninguna competencia es la única tienda en esa zona. Alfredo, por su parte, utilizará su crédito para comprar reces porque los venderá como carne. Los integrantes del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por el préstamo autorizado porque ayudara a crecer sus negocios para así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The  “Rancho Loma Bonita” (Beautiful Hill Ranch) group is based in a very beautiful and peaceful community. At the community's entrance, the members' business is visible, even though their homes are much farther away. They picked the group name because they love the place they live: a small ranch on a hill.
Adán is 54 and has been married to Guadalupe for 32 years. They formed a family together, with two children who are now grown. "Lupita" and Adán have had a grocery store for several years. It was located in their home, but they did not experience growth because it was not in a very popular area. 
Two and a half years ago, they changed the location; it is now on the edge of the highway. "Now we have seen improvement in our grocery store. We now have more clientele, so our earnings have increased."
They are now requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as bread, eggs, milk, pop, sugar, salt, etc. Adán and Lupita's store has no competition; it is the only store in the area.
Alfredo will use his loan to purchase cows to sell as meat.
The group members are very happy and grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for this loan, because it will help them to expand their businesses in order to improve their qualities of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, milk, pop, sugar, salt, etc.

location.town: Guarda de la Laguinita, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey is 23 years old and lives in Manga, Tangub City. He is single with one child. 

To earn a living, Junrey has a business selling fish. He earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan to buy additional kilos of fish to sell. Junrey added selling dried fish as another source of income.

Junrey has been a member of PMPC for eight months.  In the future, Junrey would like to expand his business and plans to have a sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of  fish to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fe is 40 years old and has one child who is in school. Fe's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Fe is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Fe has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jermelyn

texts.en: Jermelyn is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jermelyn is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for six years, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Felecitas and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Felecitas is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 8,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Felecitas has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. With your help, Felecitas can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman who has been blessed with five school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mbodze operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan  to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes  has been operating  a vegetable and fruit-selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws

loans.name: Norma Cecilia

texts.es:
Norma, es madre de tres hijos, está separada de su esposo, su actividad económica consiste en elaborar pupusas y comida para vender, su negocio está ubicado en las cercanías de una Cooperativa Agraria, lo que le favorece mucho en sus ventas.
Surtirá el inventario de su negocio con materiales que necesita para elaborar la venta y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes comprara bebidas, azúcar, carnes, pescado, verduras, aceite, quesillo, aderezos, vinagre, gas propano entre otros.
Su visión es ir creciendo poco a poco con su negocio para tener los recursos económicos que le permitan mejorar su vivienda y dar sus hijos la oportunidad de una educación académica superior.
texts.en:
Norma is a mother of three children and is separated from her husband. She works making pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and other food to sell. Her business is located near an agricultural cooperative, which is good for her sales.

Norma will use the loan to stock her business with supplies she needs to make and sell her products and improve her service. She will buy soft drinks, sugar, meat, fish, vegetables, oil, cheese curd, seasonings, vinegar and propane gas, among others.

Her plan is to continue growing her business a little bit at a time so that she can have the financial resources to improve her house and give her children the opportunity to go to university.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food production/sales business, such as soft drinks, sugar, meat, fish, vegetables, oil, cheese curd, seasonings, vinegar and propane gas.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde se paga el alquiler Victor es abogado, entre las condiciones duras de su trabajo esta el ser agredido por la gente cuando Victor entrega notificaciones Victor tuvo un accidente y se fracturo un hombro, por lo que fue sometido a una intervencion quirurgica, necesita dinero para cubrir los gastos de la hospitalizacion Ademas, Victor es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Victor is single and doesn't have children.  He lives with his parents in a brick and cement house he rents in the city of La Paz.  He's a lawyer.  One of the rough things about his work is being assaulted while delivering notices to people.  Victor had an accident and fractured his shoulder.  He had surgery and needs money to cover hospital costs.  Furthermore, Victor is his household's sole breadwinner, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to cover hospital costs because he broke his shoulder.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Doña Sandra, tiene muchos deseos de ver concluida las mejoras de infraestructura en su hogar, sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, Sandra se dedica a su pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, obteniendo también el apoyo económico de su esposo, ella solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para poder poner cielo raso y cambiar parte del techo que aún tiene pendiente, con el crédito anterior tuvo que invertir en la instalación de aguas negras, en esta ocasión su objetivo es terminar la obra.
texts.en:
Sandra has a great desire to finish the improvements to her home's infrastructure. 
Her children are grown and independent. Sandra runs a small grocery store from her home. She also has economic support from her husband.
She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials in order to install the ceiling and to change part of the roof. With her previous loan, she had to invest in the installation of a sewer. Her goal now is to finish the work.

loans.use: to buy Plycem cement, purlin beams, and zinc laminate.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children, and all of them go to school.  She also takes care of additional family   members (mother and two cousins).  She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She works at the market five days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Evin Antonio

texts.es: Evin Antonio, del Municipio de Muey de los Bueyes, se ha dedicado al Comercio de Cerdos por muchos años, su esposa se dedica a la venta de granos básico tales como maíz y frijoles quien  le apoya con los gastos del Hogar y en conjunto han salido adelante, sus dos hijos mayores ademas de estudiar también le ayudan con las tareas diarias, y la bebe de meses de nacida permanece al cuidado de su mamá;  don Evin tuvo la mala experiencia que un socio le robó de la Comercialización de los Cerdos en años anteriores, por lo que se ha visto afectada su economía, con lo poco de ganancia que le quedo ha continuado su Negocio pero necesita incrementar sus ventas de cerdos por lo que necesita financiamiento para poder comprar mas cerdos y obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de los mismos.
texts.en: Evin Antonio, from the municipality of Muey de los Bueyes, has been working in the pig industry for many years. His wife sells basic grains such as corn and beans which helps with the household expenses and together they have come out ahead. In addition to studying, their two eldest children help with daily chores and the baby is taken care of by her mother. Evin had a bad experience years ago, a partner stole his pig business which affected him financially. With the little earning he had left he continued his business but he needs to increase his pig sales to be able to purchase more pigs and obtain a better earning with the sales.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to sell.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with seven children, four of whom go to school. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and cosmetics. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include electricity outages and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and to educate her remaining children up to the university level. She resides in a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married with one child. She is 42 years old and lives in Barangay Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City.

Daisy sells a used clothing locally known as ukay-ukay to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to buy new bundles of used clothing to sell.

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Daisy hopes to expand and sustain her business and thereby be able to afford a good education for her child.

loans.use: to buy new bundles of used clothing, known as ukay-ukay

location.town: Tangub-Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
On November 8, 2013, Grace's business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business, has been in NWTF since 2013, and is now requesting a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Grace will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

Elvie has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2013. She is applying for a 8500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to buy building supplies and pay for construction labor so she can build a new house for her family. In the future Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

With your help Elvie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 51 years old, married and has seven children. With four children currently in school, Eugenia works very hard to provide for her family.

Eugenia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Eugenia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She is applying for a 7300 PHP housing loan through NWTF to buy construction supplies and hire labor to rebuild her family home.

Eugenia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and hire labor

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha always struggles to improve her grocery business, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy beans, vegetables, oil, fruit, chicken, and food packaging. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy beans, vegetables, oil, fruit, chicken, and food packaging.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes, desde niño aprendió de su padre a cultivar plátano, pipián y maíz, ya tiene 20 años de trabajar independiente, su negocio ha ido evolucionando poco a poco, actualmente también tiene la crianza de ganado y una pequeña panadería, son los medios que le dan los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante.
Utilizara el préstamo para fortalecer su negocio comprando abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, semilla, papel, azúcar, harina, leña, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para realizar sus diferentes actividades, espera mejorar la productividad, ventas e ingresos que le ayudaran a cumplir con sus compromisos.
Su visión es ahorrar lo suficiente para ampliar su vivienda y comprar una motocicleta para distribuir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and their children already live on their own. When he was a child, his father taught him how to grow bananas, squash and corn and now he has been working independently for 20 years. His business has been developing little by little and he currently also raises cattle and has a small bakery. Those are the means by which he makes an income necessary to get ahead.

He will use the loan to strengthen his business by purchasing fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, paper, sugar, flour and firewood, among other items that are needed to carry out his various tasks. He hopes to improve productivity, sales and income which will help him fulfill his commitments. 

His vision is to save enough money to expand his home and to buy a motorcycle to better distribute his products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticide, seeds, paper, sugar, flour and firewood, among other items.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito, necesita capital para surtir su inventario comprara ropa interior para ambos sexos, faldas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas, trajes y pagara un local en el mercado municipal, le será de mucha ayuda para aprovechar la temporada de vacaciones.
El efecto que tuvo con el crédito anterior fue positivo ya que cuenta con más clientes satisfechos, las ventas y ganancias aumentaron, ha cancelado sus deudas y apoya a su familia.
texts.en:
Tito needs capital to stock his inventory.  He'll buy men's and women's undergarments, skirts, shirts, dresses, pants, blouses, and suites, and he'll pay for space at the town market.  This will really help him take advantage of the vacation season.  

He had a positive outcome from his last loan.  He has more satisfied customers, and sales and profits have increased.  He has paid off his debts and provides support to his family.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's undergarments, skirts, shirts, dresses, pants, blouses, and suits, and to pay for a locale in the town market.

loans.name: Wilber Noe

texts.es:
Wilber de 36 años de edad,  es el tercero de 4 hermanos, él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Se dedica a la agricultura, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, ellos estudian noveno, septimo y sexto grado respectivamente. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años, aprendio este trabajo porque es la unica manera que tiene de subsistir y poder sacar adelante a su familia. 

El prÉstamo lo utilizara para preparar la tierra, comprar semilla, abono y fertilizantes y asi tener un mejor cultivo y una mejor cosecha. Wilber sueña con tener una plantacion de sandia y aumentar la cosecha para obtener mas ingresos y tener unos hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Wilber is 36 years old and is the third of four brothers. He did not have the opportunity to go to school. He lives with his wife and his children, who are in the ninth, seventh and sixth grades. He has worked in agriculture for four years. He learned this work because it was the only way he had to support himself and provide for his family.

Wilber is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizer to prepare the land so that he can improve his crop and harvest. He dreams of growing watermelon to increase his harvest and improve his income. He would like his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Al-Fatimya Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fatimya. It consists of three hardworking women from Aden, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 260,000 YER from AMB, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Raeda is a very active woman from a poor family. She is a 35-year-old mother of five children. She is the leader of the group. Her oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest one is only one year old. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, however, at this point, he has become unable to look after his family. 

Raeda wanted to help him in this responsibility, so she started selling women's clothes door-to-door with a small working capital four years ago. Her income from this business is very low. Most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. On the other hand, she wants to improve her business. For this reason, she asked for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to acquire more women's clothes to resell to her customers.

Raeda looks forward to expanding her business more. She hopes to save a lot of money in order to renovate her house. So, she is awaiting your support. She is a very grateful and kind woman.

loans.use: to acquire more women's clothes to resell to her customers

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is a 43-year-old married mother of two teen-age children. They all live in the suburbs of a town located along the Lake Ohrid. Residents here practice agriculture, planting mostly wheat, corn, and beans and they sell them dried. They also have cows and sheep and they sell particularly cheese and cottage cheese. In addition to all these, they do fishing and also tourism. 

Thus, their village offers many opportunities for residents to earn a decent income for most of them. A traditional meal for them is deep fried little fish from the lake called ‘cironka’.

Lindita has been running this grocery store for a couple of months now and wants to stock it up with items to sell. Her husband works as a police officer in the nearby coastal town. Lindita will be very appreciative to all lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Edrion

texts.en: Edrion is photographed here with his wife, Elvije, and their youngest child, who is 2. Thanks to your previous financial help, Edrion bought pesticides for his plum orchards and grapevines. In addition to doing agriculture, Edrion wants to add transportation as another business activity. He wants to buy a mini-bus for passengers to cover the route from his village to Korca city. To achieve this, he needs your help again.

loans.use: to buy a passenger mini-bus

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru: Отабек активный молодой житель района Спитамен. В свои 25 лет он успел получить высшее финансовое образование, поработать по своей специальности, устроить свою личную жизнь, а также открыть свой маленький бизнес. В данный момент он занимается производством пластиковых окон и дверей. Стимулом для его продвижения является его мать, жена и двухлетняя дочь, с которыми он живет в районе. Он глава этой маленькой семьи и ответственный за их обеспечение. Отабек уже два года занимается производством пластиковых окон и дверей, на него работает один рабочий, которому он каждый месяц платит заработную плату. Отабек сейчас очень нуждается в кредите для расширения своего малого бизнеса. Он хочет купить новый станок по производству пластиковых окон и дверей. Отабек заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Otabek is an active young resident of the Spitamen district. At just 25 years old, he was able to attain a Bachelor degree in economics, work in his profession, situate his personal life, and also open his own small business.  At the present time, he is involved in manufacturing plastic windows and doors. His mother, wife and two-year-old daughter, with whom he lives in their district, are the inspirations for his progress. He is the head of this small family and responsible for supporting them. Otabek has been involved in manufacturing plastic windows and doors for two years and has one employee, whom he pays a monthly salary. Otabek currently needs a loan to expand his small business. He wants to purchase a new machine to manufacture plastic windows and doors. Otabek is grateful for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to manufacture plastic windows and doors

loans.name: Narzigul

texts.ru:
Нарзигул милая и добрая душой женщина в возрасте 42 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится  на заработках заграницей. С ней живет ее сын. Ему 17 лет. Он ученик средней школы. 
         Отец Нарзигул занимался торговлей, и она тоже унаследовала данную деятельность. Нарзигул научилась у отца всем тонкостям данного бизнеса. У нее есть торговая точка, где она сама занимается продажей товаров. Нарзигул на сегодняшний день имеет некоторые проблемы с финансами. Она хочет взять кредит, и намерена использовать все сумму денег для привозки товара на лето и купить холодильник, чтобы хранить мороженное и холодные напитки. С данной целью она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Narzigul is a cute and kind 42-year-old woman. She is married. Her husband is working abroad. Her 17-year-old son lives with her. He is a student at a secondary school. Narzigul's father was involved in sales, and she also inherited this business. Narzigul learned all of the nuances of this business from her father. She has a retail outlet, where she sells goods. Today, Narzigul has some problems with finances. She wants to obtain a loan and intends to use the entire sum of money to bring in merchandise for the summer and purchase a refrigerator to store ice-cream and beverages. She is requesting the loan to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and merchandise for resale

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru:
Хаитгул жительница не большого района Хуросон. Ей 66 лет. Она давно замужем. Она с мужем вырастила троих сыновей и дочку. Старшим сыновьям 30 и 25 лет. Они уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Младший сын учится в школе ему 16 лет. Дочке 20 лет она занимается земледелием вместе с отцом, выращивают сельскохозяйственные культуры.
    Сама Хаитгул в течение многих лет дома занимается скотоводством. Хаитгул любит животных и держит у себя телят. На сегодняшний день у нее один теленок и она хочет расширить поголовья скота и найти источник доход. Хаитгул считает, что она набралась достаточного опыта, чтобы расширить не большой бизнес. На заемные деньги она купит скотов.
texts.en: Haitgul is a resident of a small district of Khuroson. She is 66 years old. She has been married for a long time. She and her husband raised three sons and a daughter. The oldest sons are 30 and 25 years old. They left to work in the Russian Federation. The youngest son attends a school. He is 16 years old. The daughter is 20 years old, and she is involved in farming, growing agricultural crops, together with her father. Haitgul has been involved in animal husbandry at home for many years. Haitgul loves animals and keeps calves. Today, she has one calf and she wants to increase her livestock headcount and find a source of income. Haitgul thinks that she has gained enough experience to expand her small business. She will buy livestock with the borrowed money.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her sister. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last four years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy 20 bags of charcoal for sale. Her challenge includes transportation. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and do away with paying rental dues for the stall in the market where she operates. She joined MCDT because she failed to get financial assistance from relatives. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school dues and rent.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Celino

texts.es: Don Celino es un hombre muy amable pero sobretodo muy trabajador tiene 43 años de edad está casado desde hace 14 años con la señora Paula juntos han formado una familia con dos niñas las cuales se encuentran estudiando una de ellas en la primaria y otra en la secundaria, para Don Celino es muy importante la educación de sus hijas por eso mismo trabaja muy duro para obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Él tiene varios negocios como una tienda de abarrotes, venta de refacciones, elaboración de puertas y ventanas, tiene una papelería, platica que todos sus negocios han sido gracias a varios prestamos poco a poco ha ido creciendo, Pero esta vez está solicitando un crédito para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes porque quiere surtirla mejor, “Anteriormente esta tienda era de un hermano mío pero se le dificulto continuar con el negocio pero me eligió a mi porque creyó que yo era el indicado para continuar con la tienda de abarrotes”. La única dificultad para Celino es la falta de dinero para invertir un poco más en su negocio, mientras que su meta es poder obtener un crédito mas grande para poder ampliar su papelería. Su ubicación es muy buena por eso mismo quiere hacer mas grande su papelería.
texts.en:
Celino is a very kind man. He is, above all, very hard-working. He is 43, and has been married to Paula for 14 years. They have formed a family together, with two daughters who are in school. One of them is in primary and the other in secondary school. For Celino, his daughters' education is very important. He therefore works very hard to make the necessary income to cover his family's basic costs. 
He has several businesses including a grocery store, spare parts sales, making doors and windows, and a stationery store. He says that all of his businesses have been growing bit by bit thanks to various loans.
This time, he is requesting a loan to stock his grocery store because he wants to have more stock: "Before, this store belonged to one of my brothers, but it was hard for him to continue. He picked me because he thought that I would be good to keep it going."
Celino's only difficulty is a lack of funds to invest in his store a bit more. His goal is to be able to obtain a larger loan in order to expand his stationery store. His location is very good, so he wants to expand his stationery store.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, pop, etc for his grocery store.

location.town: San Pablo Tlachichilpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mauricio Arturo

texts.es: Mauricio tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y dos hermanos. Mauricio se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de maíz y plátano. Es un joven muy trabajador quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para apoyar a su familia con la economía del hogar. Mauricio solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda el cual con el tiempo se ha deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos y dar inicio a la reparación antes que el invierno llegue.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 19 and lives in his own home with his parents and two children. He works mainly in agriculture, cultivating corn and plantains. Mauricio is a very hard-working young man who does everything he can to help his family with the household costs. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI because he wants to repair the home's roof; it has deteriorated with time. 
In order to fix the roof, he is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of galvanized laminate, wood, and nails in order to start the repairs before the winter comes.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both in school. For the past four years, Zubeda has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Zubeda has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers and hair treatments for the salon and will help Zubeda generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Zubeda hopes that, in the future, she will be able to operate a beauty salon and also start selling cosmetics. 

Zubeda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zubeda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers and hair treatments for the salon.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto has been farming for more than 10 years and is able to provide for his family's basic needs. He plants and harvests corn to sell in the local community to earn a living. He also earns income by working for hire in the neighborhood. His previous loans were used for improvements on his farm and he successfully repaid them with his generated income. He took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for his corn production business in preparation for the next planting season. In the future, Roberto would like to save for an emergency fund for the future and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda manages their own farm growing bananas for sale to earn a living. Over more than six years in farming, she was able to improve her ability in farming and has successfully repaid her previous loans used for her farm. To prepare for the next planting season, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
For a living, Myrna helps her husband manage their own corn farm. She has been doing this for years and it helps a lot to support the basic needs of the family. She also sells barbecue sticks in town and earns additional income for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for farming. 

Currently, Myrna is taking a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and seeds. She hopes to generate additional income in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Meet Janice, a mixed farmer and a mother of three children who lives in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya. She produces and sells milk, tea, and a variety of crops. She also has a motorbike that she uses to transport her produce to the market and to offer transportation services to the locals in the area. What she loves most about farming is tending her farm and animals, while her biggest challenges are diseases and poor marketing conditions.
Janice chose Juhudi Kilimo because of the quality loans they offer with low interest rates. During the training given, she learned how the agricultural loans can be beneficial to farmers. Your loan will enable her to take care of her children’s schooling and her family’s needs. This will enable her to expand her farm enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old farmer living in the Siongiroi area of South Rift in Kenya with his wife and three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been farming for the past 12 years where he produces and sells milk, eggs and crops like maize and tea.

David says that farming earns him much greater returns that any other type of business, but the biggest challenge he faces is lack of financing. David chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are very fast in processing client loans. Through your loan, he will purchase a dairy cow for more supply of milk and hence more profits. Through this income his living standards will improve, and he will be able to better educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lugina

texts.en:
Lugina is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Lugina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lugina has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lugina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Joseph, who hails from the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya. He does farming which enables him to take care of his five children. He produces and sells milk and eggs and also sells tea and maize.
Joseph gets satisfaction from raising dairy cows because the milk brings in good income. His biggest challenge is feeding the animals during the dry season because there is a lack of food and water for livestock. He chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it caters to the interests of small-scale farmers.The loan will enable him to add more cows for more milk production and thus generate more income.This income will enable him to educate his children better and also improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a widowed woman who has been blessed with seven children, five of whom are in school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mupa has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, se siente satisfecha por los resultados que ha tenido al invertir en su negocio el crédito anterior, pudo surtir de mercadería fresca su inventario, su cartera de clientes y productos que ofrece en su negocio a aumentado. Su familia se encuentra en mejores condiciones.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar zanahorias, remolachas, güisquiles, papayas, zapotes, jocotes, repollos, con los que continuara fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorando su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Emilia feels satisfied with the results she got by investing her prior loan in her business.  She was able to stock up on fresh merchandise, her clientele and the products she offers have increased, and conditions for her family are better.  

Emilia decided to seek a new loan to buy carrots, beets, güisquiles, papayas, sapotas, jocote fruit, and cabbage so she can continue to strengthen her business and improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy carrots, beets, güisquiles [a green vegetable], papayas, sapotas, jocote fruit, and cabbage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Dos depósitos con un poco de maíz y frijoles, adornan la entrada de la pequeña finca de Pedro de 54 años, un agricultor con más de 40 años de experiencia, quien desde pequeño ayudaba a su papá a cultivar maíz, frijoles y trigo para sustentar a su familia. Desafortunadamente no pudo ir al colegio, pero desde que inició en el mundo de la agricultura ha podido emprender y comprar de poco a poco huertas para poder cultivar con algo que tenía ahorrado, para poder independizarse y así proveerle a sus 5 hijos y a su esposa una mejor vida. 
Actualmente, Pedro comercializa su producto, con la ayuda de sus hijos y ayudantes, en la comunidad rural donde vive. Al terminar la cosecha, viaja por temporadas a Costa Rica para cortar café y así seguir creciendo. Sin embargo, necesita de un préstamo para comprar abono y poder pagarles a sus ayudantes, para la siembra de maíz y frijol que está por iniciar. Pedro confía que con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar sus materiales para poder retener en los depósitos la buena cosecha que se espera de esta temporada y poder venderlo más adelante a un mejor precio. Esto le permitirá pagar a tiempo y solicitar más adelante un préstamo para hacer un pozo en su finca.
texts.en:
Two storage containers with some corn and beans adorn the entrance of Pedro’s small farm. Pedro is 54 years old and is a farmer with over 40 years of experience. Since he was small he helped his father cultivate corn, beans, and wheat to sustain his family. Unfortunately, he couldn’t go to college but since starting in farming he has been able to start and buy, little by little, with his savings, land to cultivate in order to become independent and provide a better life for his 5 children and wife. 

Now, with the help of his children and assistants, Pedro sells his products in the rural community where he lives. At the end of the harvest, he travels seasonally to Costa Rica to pick coffee and thus continue growing. However, he needs a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay his assistants for cultivating corn and beans which is about to begin. Pedro believes that with the help of the loan he will be able to purchase his materials to be able to hold his harvest in the storage containers expected this season and be able to sell it earlier at a better price. This will allow him to pay on time and request a loan later on to drill a well on his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay his assistants for cultivating corn and beans.

loans.name: Elmer Ernesto

texts.es:
Elmer de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta casado, su esposa trabaja vendiendo ropa en los pueblos, son padres de dos hijos menores de 9 y 5 años de edad, que estudian. 

Elmer trabaja como empleado, tambien con ganado tiene nueve años de dedicarse a este negocio y lo aprendio del suegro y se dedico a esto para forjarse un mejor futuro para sus hijos; asi tambien se dedican a vender ropa en los pueblos no habia otro negocio antes, viaja en bus y se involucra la esposa y su horario es variado porque los dias libres son los que se dedica a la actividad de vender ropa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitandoa CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ganado de repasto, le mejorara ya que esta trabajando por mejorar su condicion y calidad de vida. 

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, y en cuanto a su familia que estudien y se preparen academicamente. El prestamo le ayudara mucho porque puede comprar ganado y asi poder superarse. las ganancias las utiliza para su familia y para ir pagando el préstamo, desea seguir trabajando y lo lograra con el apoyo de su familia, la buena administracion y ademas que Credicampo le siga apoyando con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 35 years old and studied up to Grade 3. He is married, his wife works selling clothing in the community. He is the father of two children aged 5 and 9, who study. Elmer works as an employee but also he has had 9 years of raising cattle. He learned this from his father-in-law and he does it to ensure a better future for his children. He also sells clothing in the communities that didn't have this type of service before. He does this with his wife and travels by bus. His timetable is varied as on his days off he works selling clothing.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy cattle. This will help him to improve the conditions and quality of living. His dream is to continue to work as well as he can and he wants his children to continue to study and prepare themselves. The loan will help him as he can buy cattle and get ahead. He will use the profits for his family and to pay off the loan. He wants to continue working and will achieve this with the help of his family, good management and with CreditCampo continuing to support him with loans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta septimo grado. Esta acompañada, su compañero de vida es agricultor, vive con sus hijas, ellas estan estudiando septimo y tercer grado. Ofelia hace pan para vender. Ofelia es ama de casa, ella tiene un negocio pequeño de hacer pan, sus niñas le ayudan a vender en los cantones vecinos, ella aprendio este negocio de su mamà desde muy niña, ya que su mamà con este negocio ha subsistido.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas y para la instalacion de la energia electrica. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el cultivo, tendra energia en su casa y sus hijas viviran mejor; porque el credito le servira para comprar lo necesario.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 28 years old. She studied until the seventh grade. She lives with her life partner, who is a farmer, and her daughters, who are in the seventh and third grades. She is a housewife, and has a small business of making bread to sell. Her children help her sell in the neighboring cantons. Ofelia learned this business from her mother when she was a very young girl, because her mother supported them with this business.

The loan will be used to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides and to install electricity. The loan will help improve the crop, install electricity in their house and allow their daughters to live better, because the loan will help them buy what they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides and to install electricity.

loans.name: *al-Amal* Group

texts.en:
This group is called *Al-Amal*. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB.

Afrah is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She works as a tailor. Her business was set up in her place of residence many years ago. She sews all kinds of clothes for the people in her area. 

She works with an old and traditional sewing machine, and this old machine makes her feel tired quickly. Also, she takes a long time to achieve a small work. This affects her business negatively. She wants to prepare more sewing, so she decided to replace her old sewing machine with a new one. Afrah couldn't afford this thing. 

Her neighbor woman helps her through cutting the fabrics, and Afrah sews them with her old machine. She is a very detail-oriented and does a very good job, allowing her to have the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors. Afrah is asking for a loan 40,000 YER from AMB to purchase a new sewing machine to use instead of the old one.

Afrah looks forward to obtaining better profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to use instead of the old one.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Farming is the main source of income for Adelaida. She has been planting and harvesting corn for her family. Her previous loan, which was used for farming, was successfully repaid. She always finds ways to earn an income. Aside from farming, she used to work as a hired laborer. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the next planting season. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and  seeds

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, one of whom attends school. The family lives in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Annet has been selling yellow bananas in the market for years, working seven days a week. She also sweeps roads as another source of income. Her challenges include seasonality of her bananas, transportation and thieves.

Annet joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital to support her business. She is applying for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more bunches of yellow bananas to sell. Her dream is to become a wholesale dealer.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Neris Rosaura

texts.es: Neris tiene 25 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño de 7 años de edad y una niña de tres meses de edad. Neris se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Neris habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea mejorar las bases de un cuarto por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de pilares de cemento para lo cual comprará cemento, arena, hierro y pagará por la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Neris, age 25, is a single mother with a 7-year-old son and a three-month-old daughter. Neris has offered home services for a long time; this is how she provides for her family. Neris lives in very humble conditions and wants to improve the floor of a room. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in a cement floor. She will purchase cement, sand and iron, and pay the labourers for the construction.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and iron, and to pay the labourers to install a cement floor.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a divorced mother of five children, four of whom go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mwaka cooks fried potatoes to sell to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  Besides the water-selling business, Chizi sells fruits and vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Blanca Celina

texts.es:
Blanca, ha mejorado el inventario de su negocio gracias a la inversión del crédito anterior ella ofrece a sus clientes mercadería de calidad y a mejor precio, su grupo familiar se mantiene  y su economía es más estable.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, huevos, especias, detergentes, jabón, aceite, pan, dulces, etc., todo lo necesario para seguir creciendo con su negocio y tener ganancias para cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Blanca has improved her business’ inventory thanks to the investment of her previous loan. She offers her customers quality products and at a better price. She is keeping her regular group and her economy is more stable.

In this opportunity she is requesting a new loan to buy basic grains, drinks, eggs, spices, detergent, soap, oil, bread, candies, etc. All of the necessary items to continue growing her business and have profits to pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, eggs, spices, detergent, soap, oil, bread, candies, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth Johanna

texts.es:
La tienda de Elizabeth ofrece a sus clientes una gran variedad de gorras y fajas para todos los gustos. Su negocio fue herencia de su padre, quien falleció hace seis meses, dejándoles un legado de conocimientos  que les servirá para dirigirlo correctamente. Su madre y hermana son un apoyo incondicional con el que cuenta siempre.
Elizabeth desea seguir  los pasos de su padre, por eso ha decido ampliar el negocio abasteciendo la tienda con nuevas marcas en su mercadería. Además planea vender sus productos en diferentes departamentos del país. Gracias a KIVA MiCrédito,  sus sueños están a punto de cumplirse, ya que con el préstamo que solicito podra comprar gorras, fajas entre otros articulos y asi aumentar el  inventario de productos. Todas las ganancias serán para beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth's store offers her clients a large variety of hats and belts for all tastes. She inherited the business from her father, who passed away six months ago, leaving a great legacy of knowledge which will serve his family in properly running the business. Elizabeth's mother and sister are unconditional supports which she can always count on.
Elizabeth wants to follow in her father's footsteps. She has decided to expand the business, stocking the store with new brands.
She also plans to sell her products in different areas of the country.
Thanks to Kiva and MiCredito, her dreams are about to be accomplished. With this loan she will purchase hats, belts and other items in order to increase her inventory. 
All of her earnings will be for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy hats, belts, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water, bread, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single young man from Deir Al Balah City. He lives alone in a small room. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. It barely covers all his needs. Mohammad would like to improve his living conditions and buy all the things he needs.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system for his home. By taking this loan, Mohammad can have hot water without having to use electricity. This is very important to his daily activity. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and purchase a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of his family's needs. Mahmoud would like to improve the family's living conditions by finding another job. He decided to buy a rickshaw one year ago to transfer goods to the local traders.
 
Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair his rickshaw so he can continue his work. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to repair his rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee and buy more education equipment

loans.name: Esmilda Espinoza

texts.es: Doña Esmilda de 44 años de edad, habita en la libertad a unos 30 kilómetros de distancia de la Cabecera departamental de Chontales, donde ofrece su variedad de platillos a clientes establecidos, cuenta con la ayuda económica y moral de su compañero de vida quien es pequeño minero desde hace pocos meses, sus hijos son mayores de edad el menor estudia en una escuela pública y por la tarde le ayuda con las actividades del negocio.  Actualmente tiene demanda de los servicios Gastronómicos que ofrece pero no cuenta con el recurso suficiente para abastecer su clientela por lo que necesita financiamiento para la compra de azúcar, frijoles, Carnes de Res y Cerdo, y de esta manera incrementar su negocio y mejorar su nivel vida.  esta muy agradecida con Kiva por brindarle apoyo pues con el crédito anterior logro cambiar una parte del zing de su cocina el cual pretende continuar con la mejora en un futuro.
texts.en:
Esmilda, age 44, lives in La Libertad, 30 kilometres from la Cabecera, Chontales department. She offers a variety of dishes to established customers. She counts on her partner's economic and moral support; he has been a miner for a few months. Their children are grown; the youngest studies at a public institution and helps her with the business in the afternoons.
She currently has demand for her services, but does not have sufficient resources to fill it. For this, she needs a loan for the purchase of sugar, beans, beef, and ham. She will improve her business and standard of living through this loan. 
Esmilda is very grateful to Kiva for providing this support. With her previous loan, she was able to change part of her kitchen's roof. She plans to continue with improvements in the future.

loans.use: to buy basic items for catering.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She is also looking after two grandchildren.
