Mupa is a widowed woman who has been blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mupa has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik is 58 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She lives with her husband. Her husband is a constructor and works at a private company. Their two children are already married, and they live separately with their families. Arpik is an accountant. For 20 years, she has been the chief accountant of a sport school in Vanadzor. She also runs the accountancy of several food markets to increase their family income. This gives them an opportunity, from time to time, to support their children's families as well.
 
Arpik is asking for a loan of 300,000 AMD to buy a computer. With her occupation, it is just impossible to work without a computer. This will make her work easier and quicker.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married with eight children, five of whom are in school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kadzo has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Las Amazonas De Atalaya Group

texts.es: Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron el banco comunal “Las Amazonas de Atalaya” en el poblado de Atalaya. Yudid tiene 30  años de edad y vive en el poblado de Atalaya, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde prepara almuerzo y cena. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, arroz y azúcar. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de fruta, venta de madera, venta de ropa, venta de comida, a la crianza de animales menores y otras cosas más. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (El poblado de Atalaya ubicado a orillas del rió Madre de Dios y se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors make up the communal bank "Las Amazonas de Atalaya" en the village of Atalaya.

Yudid is 30 years old and lives in the village of Atalaya. She is a responsible and kind person who is always looking to the future. Her main occupation is food sales; she has a small restaurant on her property where she serves lunch and dinner. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to purchase supplies such as meat, vegetables, rice, and sugar.

This communal bank is defined by its members who always are searching for opportunities to continue moving forward and give their children a better future through their daily efforts. The members work in agriculture; fruit, wood, clothing, or food sales; and animal breeding, among other things. All of the members are grateful for this opportunity offered them, and they commit to paying back the installments by the established deadlines.

(The village of Atalaya is located on the shore of the river Madre de Dios [Mother of God] and is notable for trade in forest products, as well as lodging and restaurants. It is a point of entry to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meat, vegetables, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Bibata

texts.fr:
Madame BIBATA est  née  en 1981 à KAI C/KADIOLO,  mère de 2 enfants, elle réside avec  son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à KAI un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ième region administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame BIBATA après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée très vite des activités d’achat et de vente de friperies il y’a 4 ans, elle s’approvisionne à SIKASSO.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un sixième prêt individuel commerçant ( PIC). 
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 balles de friperie pour la revendre au détail sur place et au marché  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 82 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bibata was born in 1981 in Kai C/Kadiolo. She has two children and lives with her husband and children in a traditional family in Kai, a village in the Kadiolo district, in the Region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

After having tried various business activities without success, four years ago Mrs. Bibata turned to buying and selling used clothing. She stocks up in Sikasso.
In order to meet the ever growing customer demand, she is applying for a six individual entrepreneur’s loan. This loan will allow her to buy two bales of used clothing to resell retail locally and at the market place to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit.
She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 82,000 West African francs per moth. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan, with the remainder used for her savings.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer  grado de nivel académico,  está acompañado   la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han  procreado 3 hijo en este matrimonio y ellos son los que bien con él y su esposa por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad,  este trabajo se lo enseño un tío que siempre lo apoyaba a él en su trabaja y así fue como aprendió el oficio; pero también por las tarde se dedica a la venta de pan,  él anda en una motocicleta vendiendo pan por los cantones aledaños, en este trabajo de la panadería le ayuda al hermano y en la mañana hace el trabajo de la agricultura esto lo hace de las 7 am a las 11 am y la venta de pan de las 2 pm a las 6 pm.

El  préstamo solicitado lo necesitara, para comprar una motocicleta que la utilizara para vender pan, debido a que la que esta utilizando es de su hermano y ya quieren contratar a otra persona más a vender pan , ya que el negocio les va dando muchas ganancias  y es por eso que quiere comprar una motocicleta  nueva que le de más rendimiento en las  calles de los cantones que anda vendiendo; esto le ayudara mucho porque una motocicleta  nueva es más económica de gasolina y se arruinan menos y eso que antes pagaba en gasolina hoy le quedaría a él para los gastos de la familia.

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre poder  cultivar  la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa, poder tener  su propia panadería y así poco a poco ir adquiriendo bienes materiales.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old. He only studied through the academic level of third grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have 3 children together from this marriage. These children are the ones that live with them, so they are the only ones that are dependent on him.

José has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old. An uncle who was always supportive of him taught him this work, so that is how he learned it. In the afternoons he also sells bread. He rides on his motorcycle selling bread in all the nearby cantones [a territorial division]. In this bread-selling job he is helping out his brother. In the mornings, he does his agricultural work, from 7:00am until 11:00pm. He sells bread from 2:00pm until 6:00pm. 

He will use the loan he has requested to buy a motorcycle that he will use to sell bread. The one he is using belongs to his brother and they want to hire another person to sell more bread. The business is earning them a lot of income, so he wants to buy a new motorcycle that will get better mileage on the streets of the cantones where he sells. This will help him a lot because a new motorcycle is more economical with gasoline and will break down less often. What he used to pay for gasoline he will now be able to use for his family’s expenses.

His dreams are to always cultivate the land so he’ll have food to bring home, to be able to have his own bread business, and to acquire real estate bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that he will use to sell bread.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 33-year-old married woman. She has five children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She  knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Mila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been operating a clothes-selling business. She appreciates the support of the previous loan, which helped her to boost her business. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Mary dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who has been blessed with two school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has been operating a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Halima dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more crushed rock to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bed covers, cosmetics and house ware to sell

loans.name: Shahidan

texts.en: Shahidan is a 46-year-old married woman. She has two children. She has been running a business selling milk with the support of her husband.  Shahidan has become well-known for providing high quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 9th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She hopes to boost her earnings through her larger sales and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his work.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with two children who are adults.

Fatuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a single woman with one child who still attends school and is still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the child.

Sakina has operated a clothes selling business at the market where she sells to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Sakina dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha was born in 1954. She is a married woman who has been sewing bed covers and some clothes for the last 10 years at her house. Later on, she started sewing curtains and other types of covers and sheets, depending on what her customer wants. She has been doing this for 4 years. She is now planning to raise her productivity as she is receiving more requests from her customers. For that, she has applied for this loan in order to buy a new sewing machine to raise her productivity and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Eveling Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra Eveling para una institucion publica desde hace 4 años asistente en contabilidad, actualmente este credito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construccion como zinc, cemento, ladrillos y perlines, ya que fue afectada su casa de habitacion en el are de los dormitorios lo que fue el techo y paredes con los temblores que ocurrieron en el mes de abril 2014, agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo brindado al facilitarle este credito con lo podra mejorar su casa y darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eveling has worked as an assistant bookkeeper for a public institution for four years.  She now needs the loan to buy construction materials like zinc, cement, bricks, and beams.  This is because the walls and the roof of the bedrooms were affected by the tremors that occurred in April, 2014.  

She is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support provided with this loan.  With the loan she will be able to improve her house and give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her house (the bedrooms).

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Las Hormiguitas” en el poblado de Pilcopata. Cecilia tiene 57 años de edad y vive en el poblado de Pilcopata, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde prepara almuerzo y cena. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, arroz y azúcar.  

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de madera, venta de ropa, venta de comida, a la crianza de animales menores, a la construcción de casas y otras cosas más. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (El poblado de Pilcopata se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends make up the Las Hormiguitas communal bank in the town of Pilcopata.  Cecilia, age 57, lives in the town of Pilcopata.  She is a responsible and kind person who gets ahead.  Her main business activity is selling food.  She has a small restaurant at her house.  She prepares lunch and dinner.  At this time she needs the loan to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, rice, and sugar.

This communal bank is comprised of various people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead.  With their daily effort they are looking to give their children a better future.  The members devote themselves to agriculture, selling wood, selling clothes, selling food, raising small animals, and building houses and other things.  All of the members are grateful for the opportunity provided.  They pledge to make their different payments during the established time frame.  

(The town of Pilcopata stands out for its commerce of jungle products, its lodging services, and restaurants.  It is the entrance point for the Manu National Park).

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her furniture-making business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old, married mother of two children, both are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Arlyn has a business selling muscovado sugar in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of sugar to resell.

Arlyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 32 year old farmer and a mother of 3 children all of school going age. They live in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya where she has been doing farming for the past 5 years. Her primary source of income is milk, a variety of crops, and a retail business. What she loves most about farming is tendering her farm and animals, while her biggest challenge is diseases, and poor marketing conditions.

Jackline chose your loans because they will help her achieve her agricultural dreams of being the best milk producer in the market. These loans are given at a low interest rate. This loan will enable her expand her farming enterprise by purchasing pigs that will help her supply pork to the market and this will enable her earn more income. This will lead to her being able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchasing pigs.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en: Qamar was born in 1969. She is married and the mother of three girls and three boys. Because of her sense of responsibility toward her family, Qamar recently started selling detergent at her house in order to support her husband in improving their living conditions and to cover their children's needs. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a larger quantity of detergent in order to raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy more detergent for her business

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. In addition she sells snacks. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Mwanaharusi is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase another fishing net for her business as the business has grown. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase another fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bread, sugar, oil, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them attend school. She is also looking after her niece. She has been operating a retail shop for basic commodities in rented premises for ten years. She also earns a salary from employment as another source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more crates of soda and sacks of sugar to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to bigger premises, employ more people and go for wholesale. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She rents a house with her husband, accessing electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and bags of sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive con dos hijas de 17 y 13 años de edad, las cuales dependen económicamente de ella, su negocio consiste en la crianza de cerdos y ganado, siendo una niña aprendió de sus padres a desempeñar este trabajo y hoy en día es el medio que tiene para obtener ingresos que utiliza para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de  cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de los animales lo cual facilitara su comercialización en el mercado.
Aspira a fortalecer más su negocio, para tener los recursos económicos necesarios que utilizara para brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is married and lives with her two daughters aged 17 and 13, who are financially dependent on her. Her business consists of breeding pigs and cattle. 

As a child, she learned from her parents who to carry out these tasks. Nowadays it is the means for her to have the income needed to cover her family's necessities.

She will invest the loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed to feed them and to improve their living conditions, which in turn will facilitate their market placement.

She strives to strengthen her business, to be able to attain the economic means to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal food concentrate to feed them.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en: Suad was born in 1972. She is married and a mother of three sons and two daughters. After her husband retired, he started working in another job to be able to support their children. Suad also started a small home-based business buying and selling birds and pigeons for three years. Now she has applied for this loan to buy more pigeons and more bird food to increase her profits and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pigeons and more bird food

loans.name: Nomie

texts.en:
Nomie works hard to support her family. Nomie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nomie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Nomie has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Nomie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives in the village Khashtarak in Tavush region. Andranik lives with his retired parents, his wife and two children. His daughter is already a student and his son is unemployed. Andarnik very often used to go to the Russian Federation where he made barbecue at the cafes. During that period his father ran farming and agricultural activities. But now Andranik’s son is grown up and he plans to enlarge his farm with hope that his son will like farming activities and seriously get engaged in it. Andranik has on his farm has a pig, 5 horses, 30 chickens and a large land on which he cultivates some vegetables and fruits for their family use. 

Andranik asks this loan in order to buy several piglets, a heifer and also some animal fodder. As he says he tries to provide all the conditions for farming for his son and Andranik would be happy if his son will become a skilled and clever farmer.

loans.use: to buy several piglets, a heifer, and also some animal fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with one school-going child. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary has operated a charcoal business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maulidi

texts.en:
Maulidi has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation. 

Maulidi is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy bundles of fish and cooking fat for frying fish for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish and cooking fat for frying fish for sale in her business.

loans.name: Aren

texts.en:
Aren is 22 years old and he lives with his mother in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. Aren’s father is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Aren is in his second year of study at the paid division of the Armenian-Russian University, in the department of Government. 

After Aren's lessons at the university in the evenings, he provides a taxi service using his own car in his native city. People trust him and he has no lack of customers. He is proud that he also can somehow financially support his family. Together with his father, they also manage to cover his education costs. Recently, Aren had a car accident, but fortunately Aren was not hurt.
 
Aren is asking for this loan in order to repair his car after the accident and to continue his taxi work every evening after university classes.

loans.use: to repair his car to continue his taxi work

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 52 years old, married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Juliet has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase groundnuts, sweets, soap, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, sweets, soap, and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is separated woman who has been trying her best to support herself and her children. She came up with the idea of selling clothes and blankets at her house 2 years ago and found out that it is a good source of income. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes and more blankets to sell in order to raise her profit and income and to be a good provider for her children.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a power generator for his store.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a mixed farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya where he lives with his wife and three children, all of whom are of school going age. He produces milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of  crops, which he sells at the local market. His biggest challenges in farming are diseases affecting crops and livestock, and poor market conditions.

Andrew chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer quality loans with lower interest rates. With this loan, he will purchase dairy feed for his dairy cows to enable them to produce more milk. He says that he will be able to expand his farm and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 loan Mariamu wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business; she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) sales business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a weaving business. She faces the major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem was born in 1964. He is married and has two sons. Hand, his supporting wife, is working as a tailor to support him to cover their sons' needs.

After he retired one year ago, Hatem opened his mini-market in order to be a good provider for his family. He is now seeking a loan to stock his mini-market with new food products that his customers have been requesting recently. This will help to raise his profits.

loans.use: To stock his mini-market with new food products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with six children who attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She mentioned price fluctuation as her major business challenge.  Grace dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en:
Jodelyn is a 26-year-old single woman, and is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has operated a handwoven-mat making business in the Philippines for 5 years.  

Jodelyn requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her handwoven-mats.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her handwoven-mat business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lourdes successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lourdes's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 52 year-old Adama.  She is married and has 4 children.  In 2006, Adama established her groundnut business. She began her business because she was raised farming.  After she got married, her elder sister gave her some money to start bread business. She later changed the business to selling groundnuts because of poor sales and low income.  By working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of groundnuts. In the future, Adama plans to develop her piece of land and rent a shop. This loan will help increase her profit. She is ambitious and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha  is married and a mother of three children, all of whom still attend school. She owns a house does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and others nearby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

She is requesting for a loan of Kes 30,000 to purchase fish, frying oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, frying oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some African and European movies, gasoline for the generator, and other items for her video club.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en: Janat is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She generates additional income from selling eatables. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married mother of two kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanalima has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces the challenge of competition in her business. Mwanalima dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jowe

texts.en: Jowe is a single mother of four children and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 800.000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling and frying eatables. She works in her shop seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, biscuits, bread, wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, biscuits, bread, wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with seven school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been the unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de grandes aspiraciones y metas, ella vive en una finca pero planea desplazarse para el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral para cumplir un sueño.
Ella desea tener una tienda de abarrotes en la cual pueda vender todos los productos que componen la canasta familiar, el problema que no cuenta con los recursos para realizarlo.
Por eso acude a un apoyo económico para poder cumplir con su deseo y de esta forma contribuir con el sostenimiento del hogar compuesto por ella, su esposo y sus dos hijos.
El dinero seria invertido en mejoras locativas, compra de vitrinas, estanterías, un enfriador y compra de surtido de diferentes productos.
Su mayor satisfacción seria poder tener su tienda como una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Luz is a woman of great ambitions and goals. She lives on a farm but plans to move to the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral in order to fulfill her dream.

She wishes to have a grocery store where she can sell all the products that comprise the family basket of necessities. The problem is that she does not have the resources to undertake this.

That is why she is applying for the loan so that she can fulfill her desire, and this way contribute to supporting her household, composed of her husband and their two children.

The money will be used for site improvements, purchase of display cases, shelving, a cooler and the purchase of a selection of various products. Her greatest satisfaction would be to have a store as a good source of income for her family.

loans.use: To carry out site improvements, purchase of display cases, shelving, a cooler and purchase of a selection of various products.

loans.name: Safa'a Al- Thwra 4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Safa'a Al- Thwra 4. It consists of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB. Rifat is a 41-year-old widow with five children. Her oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. She is the leader of the group. Rifat lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. She works as a cleaner in a private factory and a private school. The salary that she receives from her job is small and not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Unfortunately, their house is very old, and it is likely to fall down at any time. It needs to be renovated, which requires a lot of money, but Rifat doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Rifat is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to make a quick renovation of the house.

Rifat looks forward to renovating all of her house and living safely with her children inside the house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate her house

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Sonia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ariel Antonio

texts.es:
Todos los días a primera hora, tras haber tomado una tacita de café, Ariel ordena y crea una ambiente cálido y aseado en su local, una carnicería. Negocio que logró abrir con un pequeño capital que obtuvo después de trabajar con su padre en la venta de ganado, anhelaba independizarse económicamente, poco a poco ha salido adelante. Tiene 32 años, está soltero y tiene un hijo. Es un hombre emprendedor y amable, se muestra agradecido con su padre y su hermano por el apoyo incondicional que le han brindado.
Ariel, solicita el crédito para incrementar el capital de trabajo, requiere comprar carne, pollo, cerdo y embutidos. Aspira a formar un negocio más grande y llegar a ser distribuidor autorizado en la zona norte de su ciudad, por lo que deposita plenamente su confianza en el financiamiento. Su principal objetivo es brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, por lo que necesita aumentar su clientela y su producción. Una de sus metas próximas es  comprar una camioneta para distribuir los productos en diferentes lugares.
texts.en:
Every day, early in the morning and after having a cup of coffee, Ariel gets organized and creates a warm and tidy environment in his business, a butcher shop. It is a business that he was able to open with a small amount of capital that he obtained after working with his father selling livestock. He has been dreaming of becoming financially independent, and little by little has gotten ahead. He is 32 years old, single, and has a child. He is an entrepreneurial and friendly man, and he expresses his appreciation to his father and his brother for the unconditional support they have given him. 



Ariel requests this loan to increase his working capital. He needs to buy beef, chicken, pork, and cold cuts. He aspires to have a bigger business and be an authorized distributor in the region north of the city, and so he puts all his confidence into this funding. His primary goal is to give better living conditions to his family, so he needs to increase his clientele and production. One of his next goals is to buy a truck to distribute his products in different places.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, pork, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry fish, pepper, etc. in order to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat and fish for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30-year-old single man. He lives in a simple family in Taiz, Yemen. 

He is a university graduate, but due to the high rates of unemployment in the country, he couldn't find a job. However he didn't surrender to this condition. Ibrahim is a professional young man who is talented and responsible, so he started his own business, and has now been running it for many years. He assumed all the responsibility himself. He started in a small shop in his area selling necessary goods such as milk, drinks, cakes, flour, salt and many various kinds of food. Little by little, his business expanded and now he earns a good profit from it. Ibrahim thinks that his business is going very well because he is very kind and loves what he does. 

He could expand his small shop to a grocery, but unfortunately the city suffers from an electricity crisis and often the power goes off, which negatively affects the items for sale. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a power generator for the grocery.

Ibrahim looks forward to becoming a wholesale dealer, and hopes to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase a power generator for the grocery.

loans.name: Ndabezinhle

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Ndabezinhle from Gokwe. He is married with two children, one who is attending school. He also cares for one other dependant. Ndabezinhle runs a manufacturing business producing window frames, desks, chairs, and scotch carts. The business has been in operation for nine years. He says the main challenges faced are a lack of finance and bad debtors. 

Ndabezinhle has requested a loan of $750 to buy a welding machine and steel bars. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his sales, and hence his disposable income. In the future, Ndabezinhle plans to be dominant in the sector and provide a one-stop shop.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and steel bars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, onion, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38-year-old Wendy from Harare. She is single with two children and one is attending school.  

Wendy runs a retail business producing bedspreads, curtains, seat covers and uniforms. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenges faced are frequent power cuts, which result in them resorting to generator usage which in turn increases costs. 

Wendy has requested a loan of $300 to purchase clothing material for school uniforms. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will be used on family needs and requirements. 

In the future she plans to have a self-sustaining and viable business model which is capable of creating employment.

loans.use: to buy clothing material for winter school uniforms

loans.name: Munyaradzi

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Munyaradzi from Gokwe. He is married with three children and all are attending school. He also cares for three other dependents. 

Munyaradzi runs a retail business selling groceries like cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice, milk and kapenta (a type of fish). The business has been in operation for 1 year. He says the main challenges faced are lack of finance, poor transport and limited stocks. 

He has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to boost his business and hence increase his disposable income through increased sales that translate into profit. 

In the future Munyaradzi plans to open and operate a supermarket.

loans.use: to purcase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38-year-old Gloria from Gokwe. She is widowed with three children and one is attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Gloria runs a retail business selling beverages. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of finance and the barter trading mode of selling which hampers a quick flow of income. 

She has requested a loan of $700 to buy beverages for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to boost business and hence increase income. 

In the future Gloria plans to have electricity connected on her premises and to operate a sports club.

loans.use: to buy beverages for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bible story books, bible books, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Shuvai

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Shuvai from Gokwe. She is married with one child who attends school. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Shuvai runs a clothing business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenge faced is low business performance during the off cotton-selling season. 

Shuvai has requested a loan of $700 to purchase clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to manage to send her child to a boarding school. 

In the future Shuvai plans to own a clothing boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, and other items for her business

loans.name: José Joaquín

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo  grado,  está acompañado la esposa se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar, en esta relación han procreado un hijo de 6 años de edad.  

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad,  este trabajo se lo enseño el papá ya que desde pequeño les enseño este trabajo para que en un futuro se pudieran defender, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos y él viaja a pie; también se dedica a la venta de frutas como aguacate ya que compra y  sale a vender al mercado junto con la esposa que le ayuda, esto lo hace en un horario de las 6 am a las11 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va a cultivar en este año,  ya que se acerca la época de ir preparando los terrenos con anticipación para que a la primera tormenta poder arar la tierra y así ser de los primeros en cultivar la tierra.  Esto le ayuda mucho porque con el crédito buscara con tiempo el terreno a de ahí deja para comprar los fertilizantes que se necesita.
texts.en:
Jose, 26, has a second grade education.  He lives with his wife who is a homemaker and their six-year-old son.

Jose has been working in agriculture since he was ten years old.  When he was a boy his father taught him the trade so he could earn an income in his future.  He walks to work which is about ten minutes away.  He also sells fruits such as avocado, and his wife helps with sales at the market.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan he is requesting is to pay land rental for this year's crop.  It is the time of year to prepare the land before the first storm arrives, so he can be one of the first to plant.  This will give him time to rent the land and buy the fertilizers he needs.

loans.use: To pay for land rental for this year's crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes and add to her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for this season's coffee crop.

loans.name: Aura Cecilia

texts.es:
Ella es Aura, una mujer emprendedora, madre de dos hijos, felizmente casada desde hace 25 años.
La mayor parte de la vida laboral la ha dedicado al cuidado calificado de los niños y las niñas en la primera infancia, es docente de profesión y la labor la realizo con mucho amor y dedicación hasta hace dos años, pues las complicaciones a nivel de salud la obligaron a retirarse de esta actividad, que constantemente le implicaban agacharse, arrodillarse y estar al nivel de los niños para alzarlos, mimarlos, y alimentarlos entre otras de las necesidades básicas.
Ella hubiese querido continuar con esta labor, pues las satisfacciones que ha recibido a nivel personal y el crecimiento espiritual han sido la  mejor paga.
Aura ha trabajado desde muy niña y ninguno de los retos propuestos los ha dejado de lado, uno de ellos ha sido convertirse en empresaria de un centro de estética y generar empleo, la idea de trabajar para terceros ya no está dentro de los planes, por ello ha decidido emprender una nueva etapa en la vida que no impliquen riesgos o compliquen más el estado de salud.
Sin embargo la mayor preocupación  es buscar el recurso económico que le permita estudiar en una institución con reconocimiento a nivel nacional COSMETOLOGÍA Y ESTÉTICA, razón por la cual desde el inicio del año se dio a la tarea de buscar una entidad que le permitiera pagar cuotas moderadas aunque con gran esfuerzo deberá recaudar.
Aura ha recurrido a un método muy eficiente que no implica pago de intereses y es muy conocido por la mayoría de las personas el ahorro en la alcancía (la meta diaria es mínimo 500 pesos)  con el dinero recaudado logro vincularse a CAMPO ALTO, ya que lleno todas las expectativas.

Ella sabe que debe cohibirse de muchas cosas, como comerse un helado, comprarse unos buenos zapatos, salir con la familia, dejar de compartir con ellos, pero también sabe que cuenta con el apoyo y respaldo en todas las decisiones,  así que en un tiempo no muy lejano encontrara  un nuevo centro de estética.
Ella solicita el convenio de kiva ya que con los ahorros que ella hace no le alcanza lo suficiente para poder realizar los pagos más los gastos mensuales que esta carrera le implica, con el subsidio de kiva podría seguir haciendo el mismo ahorro pero con la plata que  ella no gastaría en el pago mensual la puede utilizar en los implemento que necesite en el estudio.
texts.en:
This is Aura, a happily married woman of 25 years and hardworking mother of two children.

The most part of her working life has been in taking care of young children up to 6 years as a teacher and does her work with a lot of love and dedication. Two years ago she was forced to retire due to health complications, being that she could not physically meet the constant need to bend down, and kneel, to the level of the children to lift, pamper, and nurture and feed them among other basic needs. She would have liked to continue with this work since the satisfaction she received on the personal and spiritual growth has been the best pay. 

Aura has worked since she was a little girl and no challenge has ever deterred her; this one being that she has decided to reinvent herself and become a business owner of a beauty and esthetics center and generate work. The idea of working for a third party is not in her plans, for this she has decided to embark on a new stage in her life that will not further implicate risks or complicate the state of her health.

Nevertheless, the biggest concern is looking for the economic resource that permits her to study in a nationally recognized institution for Cosmetology and Esthetics. Since the beginning of the year her task was to find an organization that would allow her to pay just moderate fees for the great effort it takes to raise the funds.

Aura has turned to an efficient method that does not involve interest payments and is very well known through the majority of people involved in savings; (The daily goal is a minimum of 500 pesos) all the money collected is to benefit CampoAlto, since it has met all expectations. 

She knows that will have to refrain from many things, like going to get ice cream, buying herself some nice shoes, going with the family or sharing other things. She also can count on their support and backing in all her decisions. This way, in a short time she will find a new focus in cosmetology and esthetics. 

She seeks the loan agreement with Kiva because her savings alone are not sufficient to be able to pay the monthly tuition expenses for schooling. With the help of Kiva she will be able to keep using her savings to pay for what is necessary for her studies, rather than the monthly payments.

loans.use: To pay for a semester of enrollment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and a toilet for a new bathroom.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, desea continuar fortaleciendo su negocio y por su experiencia ha comprobado que el buen uso de los créditos le da resultados positivos, en esta ocasión el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ganado para repasto, de esta manera su negocio no dejara de proporcionarle la rentabilidad que él necesita.
El crédito anterior le fue de mucho utilidad para incrementar el ganado, lo que le ha dado mejores utilidades, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado un poco, se encuentra disfrutando de la felicidad que le ha dado el nacimiento de su hijo.
texts.en:
Jose wants to continue strengthening his business, and by experience he has seen that a good use of the loans gives positive results.  This time he is requesting a loan to buy cattle for grazing so he can keep up the profitability that he needs.

He used the previous loan to buy cattle and it has been profitable.  His family situation has improved a little and Jose is enjoying the birth of his son.

loans.use: To buy cattle for grazing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a heated display case, fruit, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, okra, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Hellen from Harare. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. Hellen runs a retail business selling clothes and groceries. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenges she faces are stiff competition and the risk of accidents when traveling on long journeys to South Africa. Hellen has requested a loan of $400 to purchase fabrics for sewing. Hellen purchased groceries from South Africa for resale in the community with the previous loan. This enabled the client to make improved profits. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her child to a university and improve the general upkeep of the family. In the future, Hellen plans to extend her business to other towns by opening more branches.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sewing materials and knitting threads.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy track suits, jackets and blankets.

loans.name: Damaris Marbeli

texts.es: Doña Damaris siempre con el sueño que desea cumplir, para llegar a tener una vida mejor junto a su esposo e hijos, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Materiales de construcicon como, cemento, arena, bloques, ceramica, bondex ya que desea mejorar la fachada de la casa. Su esposo la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que los dos trabajan  y se dividen los gastos, Agradece el apoyo recibido de parte de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Damaris, with the dream she always wishes to achieve of having a better life alongside her husband and children, is asking for this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, ceramics and bondex. With these, she wishes to improve the facade of her house. 

Her husband supports her with household costs, as they both work and divide expenses. She is grateful for the support she has received from Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Cesar Candelario

texts.es: el Sr. Cesar trabaja para una institucion publica desde hace 6 años asistente de mantenimiento, actualmente este credito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construccion como zinc, cemento, ladrillos y perlines, ya que fue afectado su casa de habitacion con los temblores que en el mes de abril 2014 ocurrieron, agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo brindado al facilitarle este credito con lo podra mejorar su casa y darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Cesar has worked for a public institution for 6 years as a maintenance assistant. Right now, he needs this loan to buy construction materials such as zinc sheeting, cement, and rods. His house was affected by the earthquakes that occurred in April 2014. He is grateful to Ceprodel for the support offered to facilitate this loan with which he can improve his home and give his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, utilizo el préstamo anterior para tener a su disposición la materia prima para la venta de tortillas que sus clientes día con día demandan, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de 15 qq de maíz, para tener un mejor inventario y seguir trabajando para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Gloria used the previous loan to have raw material on hand so she can sell tortillas that her customers demand every day. Her family has a better quality of life. 

She has decided to take out a new loan to in vest in 15 quintals of corn so that she can have a better inventory and keep working to improve her financial institution.

loans.use: to buy 15 quintals of corn

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es:
Fredy de 56 años de edad, es un agricultor  que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado,  la esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, han procreado tres hijos; dos de los hijos viven con él y la otra que vive en hogar aparte, de los 2 que viven con Fredy uno estudia  y el otro  le ayuda a trabajar.
	
Fredy se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 20  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño  el papá que decidió enseñarle este trabajo, ya que es importante aprender a la agricultura porque en esta situación no se consigue trabajo alguien que no ha aprendido a leer o escribir, no fue a la escuela por eso decidió trabajar de lleno a la agricultura.

 
El préstamo que esta solicitando,  es para pagar el  alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva el maíz, ya  que el año pasado cultivo 7,000 metros cuadrados y gracias a Dios le fue bien y hoy quiere cultivar 10,500 metros cuadrados más de la que cultivo el año pasado ya que le dan la oportunidad y se la alquilan barata entonces quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad.

Desea seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa, poder darle a su  esposa un buen futuro y un día poder comprar su terreno para cultivar en lo propio y darle a sus hijos lo mejor y enseñarles el buen camino.
texts.en:
Fredy, 56, works in agriculture. He could not study. His wife works as a housewife and they have three children; two live with them and one has her own family. Of those that live with him, one goes to school and the other one helps him at work.

Fredy has been working in agriculture since he was 20 years old, taught by his father. He thought it would be good for him to learn about agriculture, thinking of how difficult it is to get a job when one cannot read or write. Since he did not go to school, he decided to work full time in agriculture.

He is requesting a loan to pay for the rent of the land where he grows corn. Last year, he worked in 7,000 m2 of land, and thanks to God [they probably mean the Christian God] he did well, so he wants to plant 10,500 m2 more this year. Someone is offering him good conditions, so he wants to take advantage of the situation.

He wishes to continue working the land in order to sustain his family. He wants to guarantee a good future for his wife and be able to buy his own land where to grow his crops. He wants to give his children the best and show them the right path.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of the land where he grows corn.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Orbelina se dedica al comercio de verduras, frutas y pan desde hace 27 años de edad. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su familia y junto a su esposo logran cubrir las principales necesidades de su hogar. Orbelina desea construir un muro perimetral y encementar el piso de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava, piedra y pago de mano de obra para la construcción dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en: Orbelina is 59 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband and children. Orbelina has worked selling vegetables, fruit and bread since she has 27 years old. This is how she earns a living and supports her family. She and her husband are able to cover the household expenses. Orbelina wants to build wall around her property and put in a cement floor. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying sand, gravel, and stones, as well as to pay for labor costs. She doesn't have the necessary financial resources to do it on her own.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, and stones, as well as to pay for labor costs for the construction of a retention wall and to put in a cement floor in her house.

loans.name: Marigor

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marigor works hard to support her family.

She has a food-production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store. Marigor is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Marigor has been sustaining her business activities through the past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making peanut butter.

loans.name: Sheka      S

texts.en:
Sheka is 42 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 17 years. He runs a local food business in Waterloo Western, a rural area in Freetown.

He has been in this business since 2009 and sells groundnuts and pepper. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenges to his business are transportation problems and the storage facilities.

Sheka requested this loan through BRAC to buy more bags of groundnuts and pepper for resale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to take care of his family's welfare and increase his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business more than ever.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts and pepper for resale.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 58-year-old Mose from Waterloo, the eastern area of Freetown. He is married with four children. He began his business because he wants to be self employed and because it is profitable.

Mose runs a general stock business--he sells soft drinks, water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2000. He works 12 hours per day and six days per week. Mose says that the main challenge to his is business is price inflation.

Mose has requested a loan in order to buy more products for his store. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and improve his standard of living. In the future he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en: Lucio is an organic certified, Maya Mountain Cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. Lucio believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop, that is both good for the environment, and will help develop his local community. He wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so that he might expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted, high-yielding, disease resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase high yielding grafted cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high yielding grafted cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, biscuits, pure water and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, butter, and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José, se decidió por otro crédito que le servirá para continuar trabajando, pagara las reparaciones al coche de la venta de cocos.
Con el capital anterior a mantenido activo su negocio sus ingresos han tenido una leve mejoría las cuales son de utilidad para cancelar la deuda y los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan which will allow him to keep working. He will pay for repairs to the car which he uses to sell coconuts.
With his previous loan, he has kept his business active and his income has increased, which allowed him to repay the debt and cover his family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to the vehicle with which he sells coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more metal material to expand his welding business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more motorbikes, spare parts and motor oil, and different kinds of machine spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chains, rings, bracelets, and makeup sets for resale.

loans.name: Dolores Elías

texts.es:
Dolores de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de nivel académico, está acompañado  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado 2 hijos en este matrimonio de los cuales los 2  están en la casa y las dos estudian,  con Dolores vive la esposa, las dos hijas y una hijastra.

Dolores se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad,  este trabajo se lo enseño el Papá ya que el papá quería que ellos aprendieran este oficio y se los  enseño para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos  y él viaja a pie, él solo a esto se dedica y lo  hace un horario de las 6 de la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar el alquiler de 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra para el cultivo de este año. Esto le ayudara mucho porque cultivara más y así serán los ingresos cuando  venda el maíz y con el crédito buscara personas que le ayuden a cercar el terreno, ya que está un poco dañado pero eso le ayudara mucho porque comprara alambre nuevo y eso lo tendrá más seguro.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 45, was in school until third grade. He is married. His wife does the housework. They have two children together, both of whom live with them and are studying. Dolores lives with his wife, two daughters, and one step-daughter.
Dolores has worked in agriculture since he was 12. His father taught him this work; he wanted his children to learn this work and taught them so that they could take care of themselves in the future. Dolores' work is 15 minutes away and he goes there on foot. This is his only job. He works from 6 am to 12 pm.
He will use this loan to pay the rent on 14,000 square metres of land for cultivation this year. This will help him greatly because he will cultivate more and his income will increase when he sells the corn. With this loan, he will also look for people to help him to fence the land, since it is a bit damaged. This will help him greatly because he will purchase new wire, and this will keep things more safe.

loans.use: to pay rent on 14,000 square metres of land for cultivation this year.

loans.name: Bibizarifa

texts.ru:
Бибизарифе 47 лет. Она сейчас активно занимается животноводством, за счет которого она обеспечивает семью не только молоком и молочными продуктами, но и доходом. Дети Бибизарифы уже совсем взрослые и помогают ей в деятельности. Ее муж находится на заработках в другой стране и все заботы о семье сейчас на хрупких плечах Бибизарифы. 
Бибизарифа очень опытный скотовод, она занимается выращиванием коров и телят на протяжении 25 лет. Она любит сое дело и теперь намеревается расширить его. Бибизарифа просит кредит, за счет суммы которого она хочет приобрести несколько голов телят. Таким образом она хочет увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Bibizarifa is 47 years old. She now actively practices livestock breeding. Thanks to this business, she provides her family with not only milk and dairy products but also an income. Bibizarifa's children are completely grown-up and help her with her business. Her husband works abroad in a different country and now all the worries of the family are on Bibizarifa's delicate shoulders.

Bibizarifa is a very experienced cattle breeder. She has been raising cows and calves for the past 25 years. She loves her business and is now determined to expand it. Bibizarifa is requesting a loan with which she wants to buy several calves. As a result, she wants to increase her family's budget.

loans.use: to buy several calves for the development of her business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is married and has four children who attend school. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He earns an income from farming. Competition and poor roads are his main challenges.

Leonard requested a loan, which she will use to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material to rebuild after the earthquake.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johana, se dispone a renovar la mercadería que ofrece en su negocio con el fin de tener a sus clientes complacidos comprara celulares, chips, cargadores, baterías, protectores entre otros.
Con el financiamiento anterior fortaleció el negocio con lo necesario para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, también ha dado una mejor vistosidad a su local, aumento sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Johana needs to recharge her business' merchandise with the goal of satisfying her customers. She will purchase cell phones, cell chips, chargers, batteries, protectors, and other items.
With her previous loan she strengthened her business with the necessary items to satisfy customer demand. She has also improved her business' image, and increased her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, cell chips, chargers, batteries, protectors, and other items.

loans.name: Ismenia Delfina

texts.es:
Ismenia, continúa mejorando la vistosidad de su negocio, por lo que opta por utilizar un nuevo crédito para comprar una mesa para ofrecer mayor comodidad y buen servicio a sus clientes.
Para la Sra.: Ismenia la inversión del préstamo anterior le ha dado un efecto positivo en su negocio, pues tiene más clientes nuevos, sus nuevos ingresos le permiten mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Ismenia is continuing to improve her business' image. She has decided to use a new loan for the purchase of a table in order to offer better comfort and service to her clients.
For Ismenia, the investment of her previous loan has been positive for her business. She has more new clients, and her new income allows her to improve her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy a table.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Amadu from Wara Wara, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. He began his business because he wanted to generate a permanent source of income to support his family. He is hardworking and desires to educate his child.   

Amadu runs a building material shop within a busy market area; he sells cement, zinc, nails and door lockers. He has been running this business since 2002. He works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., six days per week. Amadu says that the main challenge to his business is the difficulty transporting his goods and high competition in the market.

Amadu has requested a loan in order to purchase cement, zinc, nails and door lockers. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and take care of his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to develop his business. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails and door lockers.

loans.name: Gibril

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Gibril from Magbruka town, Makeni Northern area. He is married with four children. He began his business to create a permanent source of income to support the home. 

Gibril runs a general stock business; he sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since some years ago. He works at the business 13 hours per day and six days per week. Gibril says that the main challenge to his business is that sometimes purchasing power is very slow.

Gibril has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга — предприниматель-торговец из Мелитополя. Она торгует на местном рынке мужской и женской джинсовой одеждой и обувью. Ольга работает в сфере предпринимательства уже 18 лет.
