Ольга намерена закупить сезонный товар, а именно рубашки, футболки, майки, брюки, юбки и легкие джинсы на сумму 40 000 гривен для последующей реализации на своей торговой точке на рынке. Собственных средств в таком количестве у нее в распоряжении нет, поэтому она и обратилась за финансовым содействием к КИВА.
texts.en:
Olga is an entrepreneur-salesperson from Melitopol. She sells men's and women's jeans, clothes and shoes at the local market. Olga has been working in the sphere of entrepreneurship for 18 years already.

Olga is determined to buy seasonal merchandise, specifically button-up shirts, t-shirts, tank-tops, pants and light jeans, in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia for future sale at her selling stall at the market. She does not have enough personal savings at hand for this, which is why is applied to KIVA for financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise such as button-up shirts, t-shirts, tank-tops, pants and jeans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay the labour to fix her house after the earthquake.

loans.name: Motivadas Por Un Sueno 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group "Motivadas por un Sueño (motivated by a dream) 3 & 4." Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. Before Esperanza came to her community, Maribel started her business with her own saving after she worked in different jobs. This group is composed of 10 members running different businesses like shoes, clothing, cosmetics, underwear and many other small businesses.

Maribel plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing underwear to wholesale to other sellers. She has been operating this business for almost five years. She is excited to be taking out her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She will save her profits to reinvest in her business.

She makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and their only child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur YACOUBA est né en 1974 à KAI C/KADIOLO, marié, père de 7 enfants il  réside avec ses femmes et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à KAI un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur YACOUBA n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de 20 ans aux activités d’achat et de vente des marchandises divers de boutique (riz, sucre, huile, bonbon, cigarette, cube maggi, thé, etc).
Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des grossistes. Il s’approvisionne à SIKASSO et à LOULOUNI afin de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique à KAI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce neuvième prêt individuel auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce neuvième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter  5 sacs de 50 kg de riz, 4 sacs de 50 kg du sucre,  2 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 2 cartons de bonbon, 3 cartons de cigarettes, 1 carton du thé et  2 cartons de cube maggi.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Yacouba was born in 1974 in Kai C/Kadiolo. He is married and the father of 7 children, and lives with his wives and children in a traditional family in Kai, one of the villages in the Kadiolo circle of the Sikasso region (the third administrative region of Mali.) 

Yacouba did not have the chance to continue in school, so he quickly applied himself to the business of purchasing and selling various shop merchandise (rice, sugar, oil, candy, cigarettes, Maggi cubes, tea, etc.) more than 20 years ago. With his experience in this field, he has earned the wholesalers' community's trust.

Yacouba stocks up on merchandise in Sikasso and in Loulouni, and resells at retail in his shop in Kai to a customer base made up of both men and women for cash and credit. In order to better meet the ever-growing needs of his customer base, Yacouba is requesting his ninth loan through the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. This ninth loan will allow him to purchase 5 bags of 50kg of rice, 4 bags of 50kg of sugar, 2 barrels of 20 liters of oil, 2 boxes of candy, 3 cartons of cigarettes, 1 box of tea and 2 boxes of Maggi cubes.

With this loan, Yacouba hopes to earn an average monthly income of 190,000 francs CFA. With his profits, he plans to provide for his personal expenses, contribute to his family's expenses, pay back the loan and its interest, and invest the rest in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to change 2 km of PVC piping from 2 inches to 4 inches.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Sj Group

texts.es: Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron el banco comunal “Los Emprendedores SJ” en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(la socia esta levantando la mano en la fotografía).  Carmen tiene 41 años de edad y nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de flores en uno de los cementerios de la ciudad del Cusco de forma ambulatoria, ella sale a vender de lunes a viernes de 2pm hasta las 5pm y los días domingos desde las 6am hasta las 6pm. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra mas flores. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
A group of neighbours and friends formed the "Los Emprendedores SJ" communal bank in the beautiful city of Cusco. The members are all grateful for this opportunity and promise to repay their various quotas as established.
Carmen (raising her hand in the photo) is 41 and was born in Cusco. She is married and has six children. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who sells flowers in one of the cemeteries of Cusco. She does not have a fixed stall. She sells Mondays to Fridays from 2 pm to 5 pm, and on Sundays from 6 am to 6 pm. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well.
She needs a loan to purchase more flowers. She is happy to have a loan and promises to repay the quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy more flowers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 48-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with 11 children. 

He has been operating a hotel and a bar with motorcycle transport to earn a living and hopes to buy a vehicle in spite of competition from similar businesses. 

Christopher is requesting a loan to buy more utensils to use in his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to use in his restaurant.

loans.name: Gonzaga

texts.en:
Gonzaga is a 42-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

He has been operating a butcher shop together with cattle trading because the business was cheaper for him to start and he hopes to construct a permanent house in spite of price fluctuations and cattle diseases. 

Gonzaga is requesting a loan to buy cattle for his butcher shop to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his butcher shop to sell.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en:
Clovice, a 41-year-old married man, deals in the produce business, selling maize and groundnuts (peanuts) in Fort Portal; he has operated since 2000. 

His clients are those around the town where he supplies groundnuts paste and his dreams are to buy a car that can ease the supply of his products to his customers. 

Clovice will use the loan to buy ground nuts to make paste (peanut butter) for sale.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts to make paste for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a Ugandan married and hardworking man aged 44 years with four children aged between 16 and 6 years; all attend school. He lives in Kagadi, where he has been operating a retail shop and selling produce to provide necessities to his family. He hopes to grow his business despite price fluctuations. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Zachariah Junior

texts.en: Zachariah is a 23-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda, with one child aged 3 years. He has sold produce and timber since 2008. He hopes to grow his business in spite of being challenged by price fluctuations and seasonal changes. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucia has two children who are married. She operates a restaurant inside a Mexico City market, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. Her biggest achievement is that her clients consider her restaurant a great place to eat. 

Lucia requested another loan from Kubo Financiero, which she will use to refurbish her restaurant. This loan will allow her to paint and to change some of the flooring. In the future, she hopes to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to paint and make some floor improvements in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coffee field and to buy 400 coffee plants.

loans.name: Jaqueline Rosario

texts.es:
Jaqueline tiene 29 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos quienes están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella es ama de casa y agricultura actividad que aprendió gracias a su familia ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Jaqueline en compañía de su esposo se involucran en las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo como ser: la recolección del grano, limpieza de la tierra y la planta, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa pero sus padres al no poder apoyarle con sus estudios le enseñaron a trabajar para que el día de mañana ella fuese un apoyo en su familia ayudando a generar ingresos y fortaleciendo el ingreso familiar ya que en la comunidad la única fuente de ingresos es el trabajo de campo. Además de cultivar café ella también cultiva maíz y frijol siendo sus clientes las diferentes bodegas de la zona las cuales están a 10 minutos desde su casa de habitación trasladándose a pie.  
Ella solicita ayuda para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, urea, abono 12-24-12, 18-46-0 entre otros para que sus cultivos en esta nueva temporada de café no se vean afectados por la roya, plagas y estados de cambio climáticos. En un futuro ella espera adquirir un pedazo más de tierra poder cultivar de café, teniendo su familia un mejor patrimonio y puedan heredarlo para trabajarlo de esta manera enfrentar los problemas económicos y demás positiva mente.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 29 years old and has three children that go to the local school. She works as a housewife and in agriculture, something she learned from her relatives, who have been farmers for generations. Jaqueline and her husband perform different activities, such as collecting the harvest, cleaning the land and the plants, spreading compost and other fertilizers, etc.

Jaqueline finished primary school, but her parents could not pay for her studies. They taught her instead to work the land, so that she could sustain her family in the future and generate a good income. Agriculture is the only source of income for the community. Besides growing coffee, she also grows corn and beans. Her customers are local warehouses located ten minutes away from her house, so she walks to go there.

She is requesting a loan to give maintenance to her coffee plantations. She will buy supplies such as fertilizers (e.g. 12-24-12 [Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Potassium in percentage terms]) and urea. This way, her harvest will not be affected by the coffee rust disease [locally called “roya”], plagues and the changing weather.

In the future, she would like to buy more land to grow coffee. This would mean more assets for her family and a legacy for their children, so that they can work and overcome economic obstacles and other obstacles that might arise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He works in public transportation. He owns a bus and runs a specific route in Mexico City. 

Tomas requested a loan from Kubo Financiero, which he will use to build a room for his children. Because they have grown, they need more space. His biggest achievement has been acquiring his own bus and taxi that provide his family with a stable source of income. In the future, Tomas would like to buy one more taxi and continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to build a room for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, wood, and laminate in order to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Yudi Yorladi

texts.es:
Yudi es una mujer de campo muy trabajadora y diligente.
Ella, junto a su esposo se dedican a la cría y levante de cerdos y posteriormente los venden a las carnicerías del pueblo o q otras fincas.
Ellos han trabajado duramente toda su vida y han unido esfuerzos para progresar.
Ellos necesitan una ayuda para comprar un lote de cerdos para aumentar su capital de trabajo, esto les permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y aumentar los ingresos para su sostenimiento.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener su negocio bien establecido y con todas las normas de salubridad.
texts.en:
Yudi is a countrywoman. She is a hardworking and effective person. Together with her husband, she raises pigs and sells them to butcher shops in town or to local farms. They have worked hard all their lives and are now getting ahead together.

They need help to buy some pigs to increase their working capital. This will help them to improve their living conditions and increase their income.

Her biggest dream is to have a thriving business that follows all the hygiene regulations.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, who is married, opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200.00. The business, which is doing well, has made Irene independent because she can be responsible for herself and also for helping her family.

With this $600 loan, Irene will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and milks. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her cooking space

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela, married to a teacher and the mother of eight, opened her business of buying and selling buffalo in 2011 with her own working capital of $200.00. It helps her to generate income for her family. 

Manuela will use this loan to buy more buffalo. She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy buffalo

loans.name: Jovelene

texts.en:
Jovelene is married with an only child, and she operates a transportation business while her husband works on their own farm for a living. For three years in running a transportation business, Jovelene is happy to say that this helps her family a lot while waiting for the harvest from their crops. 

With her generated income, Jovelene successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying motor spare parts. In order to maintain better services, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new set of tires to replace the old ones. In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es: Gilberto de 54 años de edad  se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de maíz y frijol, sus cosechas son muy buenas por esa razón posee muchos clientes que lo prefieren, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el vive, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, El esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, entre otras cosas y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 54 years old and has made a living for several years by planting corn and beans. His harvests are very good and for this reason has many customers who prefer him. 

He sells in the areas surrounding where he lives. He manages to cover some of his household costs with what he earns from his sales. He lives with his wife and child in their own home. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seed and herbicides, among other things, so as to allow for more stable family finances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides among other things.

loans.name: Odilia De Concepcion

texts.es:
Odilia tiene 39 años y vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos con edades entre 8 y 16 años, en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Su principal actividad es la producción de café el cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

En los últimos años, esta pequeña emprendedora ha venido mejorando la productividad de su finca, y para este ciclo está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de su cafetal. 

Su sueño es continuar construyendo un patrimonio para sus hijos y apoyarlos en su formación, para lo cual trabaja diariamente junto a su esposo. Su esperanza es disponer de los recursos necesarios para continuar invirtiendo y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Odilia is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their four children who are between the ages of 8 and 16 in a community in northern Nicaragua. Her main job is producing coffee which she does under the Fair Trade certification criteria. In the past few years, the small business owner has been improving her farm's productivity.  

During this cycle, she is seeking a loan that will allow her to purchase supplies to maintain her coffee crops. Her dream is to continue building a legacy for her children and support their development, which is why she works daily with her husband. Her hope is to obtain the necessary resources to continue to invest and improve her earnings.

loans.use: purchase supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital. 

Martina will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as salt, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, bread and water. Martina is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy salt, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, bread and water

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 51 years old, married, and has children. He lives in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as a mechanic operator since 2011. Before this job, he used to work as tractor driver at an agricultural company. His wife grows and sells vegetables. 

Ganbaatar is requesting a loan for $2,000, which he will use to buy bricks, cements, planks, and shingles for house renovation. His house has been deteriorating over the years because of heavy snowfalls and strong storms. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es: Miriam de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tienen mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, Miriam esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, aceite, sopas, café, refrescos, golosinas, detergentes, jabon, etc. para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ingresos  y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their children.  She has a small store located in her home. She has a lot of customers based on the variety of products that she sells and her fair prices.  

Miriam is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soups, coffee, beverages, snacks, detergents, soap, etc, in order to better service her customers and generate greater earnings to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, oil, soups, coffee, beverages, snacks, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica  a la venta de sopas, verduras, frutas, café, detergentes, jabón, etc.  vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para la venta y así obtener mejores ganancias ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos  y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her spouse and their daughter.  She works selling soups, vegetables, fruits, coffee, detergents, soap, etc. She sells on foot in the different villages and markets that are near her home.  She has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase more products to sell and therefore obtain greater earnings since this is her only source of income. This will allow her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase soups, vegetables, fruit, coffee, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa de su esposa la cual hace muchos años recibió como herencia. Felipe y su esposa tienen tres hijos de 12 años, 9 años y 2 años de edad. Felipe posee una pequeña granja de pollos la cual es la que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Felipe desea invertir en su granja dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de 100 pollos y para comprar concentrado para alimentarlos y poder así criarlos para la venta.
texts.en: Felipe is 31 years old and lives in his wife’s house, which she inherited a number of years ago. Felipe and his wife have three children, ages 12, 9 and 2. Felipe has a small chicken farm, which allows him to meet his family’s household expenses and needs. He would like to invest in his farm, because it is his principal source of income and he would like to keep it going for many more years. For this reason, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy 100 chickens and concentrated feed to feed them so that he can raise them and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 24 years old, is single and lives with her parents. Milagros is a very loving daughter who wants to help her parents in terms of daily needs. Her parents are farmers, but their income is not enough to support the family's daily needs. That's why she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vitamins, feed, and a piglet for her business. 

Milagros dreams that her business will expand so that she can save enough money for her future family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed, and a piglet

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas chatarra para poder venderla como: chatarra, aluminio, cobre, etc. y seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 36 years old and has worked buying and selling scrap metal for a number of years. His business is located in his house. With the money he earns from his sales, he is able to pay his household expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. He is requesting this loan to buy more scrap metal such as aluminum and copper to then offer for sale. He hopes to continue with his business, because it is his only source of income. He would like to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal such as aluminum and copper to then offer for sale.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Âgée de 52ans, Akossiwa pour contribuer au bonheur de la famille,revend depuis 2007 des produits de mercerie dans une boutique louée à cet effet.  Elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère créer d'autres succursales et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Akossiwa a 04 enfants et pour mari un assureur.
texts.en: Akossiwa, 52 years, has been selling sewing supplies in a rented store since 2007 in order to contribute to the well-being of her family. She is seeking a third loan in order to stock up on merchandise and meet customer demand. She hopes to open other branches and provide for the needs of her family. Akosiwa has four children and is married to an insurance agent.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests rice. She sells the rice in the local community to earn a living. She has been operating her business for more than seven years and earns well for the family. With her income, she has been able to maintain and sustain her farm and successfully repay her previous loan for the business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC  to purchase fertilizer and new seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and new seeds

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna has been operating her own general store, while her husband does farming to make a living. For six years running the business, she has been able to maintain and sustain her store. She has also successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying stock. She always finds many ways to augment their income. To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is from Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Elizabeth provides transportation services, with the support of her husband as operator. For eight years running the business, she has been able to maintain and sustain the services. She also successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy spare parts and accessories. To purchase new tires, she took a new loan from GDMPC, her partner in improving lives. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Katherine Anthuanet

texts.es:
Katherine es una joven de 21 años la cual trabaja como empleada en una pequeña empresa de taxis, con lo cual pued tener ingresos para poder salir adelante cada día.

Katherine esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar la compra de electrodomésticos para su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en: Katherine is 21 years old and works in a small taxi business that allows her to earn an income to get ahead everyday.  Katherine is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, she will be able to purchase household appliances for her home, and in so doing, improve her quality of life, and continue working to make her dream of having her own business a reality.

loans.use: purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru:
Нина живет в городе Мелитополь. Она занимается торговлей мужской и женской одеждой на местном рынке. Работает в этой сфере Нина давно, опыт работы уже 17 лет. 
Нина намерена продолжать работать несмотря на непростые условия работы для малого предпринимательства. Люди все равно продолжают ходить за одеждой на рынки и покупать необходимые товары несмотря на напряженную ситуацию в определенных регионах Украины. Поэтому Нина планирует закупить рубашки, футболки, майки, блузки и платья для того, чтобы иметь в наличии сезонный товар под реализацию этим летом. Для этого ей нужна сумма в 30 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Nina lives in the city of Melitopol. She sells men's and women's clothing at the local market. Nina has worked in this sphere for a long time. She has 17 years of work experience.

Nina is determined to continue her work despite the challenging working conditions for a small business owner. Regardless, people continue to go shopping for clothes at the market and buy necessary goods despite the tense situation in specific regions of Ukraine. This is why Nina plans to buy button-up shirts, t-shirts, tank-tops, blouses and dresses in order to have seasonal merchandise in stock to sell this summer. She needs 30,000 hryvnia for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise like button-up shirts, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a vender refrescos y licuados su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar, la clienta solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas productos como: frutas, leche, azúcar, hielo, etc.  ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The borrower is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. She works making shakes and other drinks. Her business is located in her home. She already has many customers, because she sells her products at a good price. She makes a good profit from her sales, which she uses to pay household expenses and other necessities that come up. The borrower is requesting this loan to buy ingredients such as fruit, milk, sugar and ice, because recently she has had a lot of demand for her products. She hopes to improve her profit and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fruit, milk, sugar and ice.

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
The Gayatri Indah Group has managed to boost their families' income over the period of several loan cycles. Their revenues and livestock populations have increased.

Ni Komang has been able to increase her herd of pigs. She is very grateful for her business and her family. She would like to take a new loan to further grow her business.

One member of the Gayatri Indah Group has resigned to move to the city for work; she was replaced by a new member. Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets for fattening; each costs 500,000 IDR. She will use her own money to purchase feed. The price for feed is increasing. To reduce the cost she will give her pigs a mixed feed made of superior feed and traditional feed (made of various kinds of leaves such as banana leaves and corn powder). 

Ni Komang will use the profit to support her children's education. She has two children who are both in elementary school. Ni Komang hopes she can support her children until they enter university.

loans.use: to purchase four superior piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en:
Mr. Bazarragchaa, 43 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrical engineer at an aviation company since 2010. His wife is unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. 

Their house has deteriorated over the years and now needs serious repair. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, planks and fiberglass. After renovations, his family will burn less coal for heating, resulting in less air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Buviniso

texts.ru: Бувинисо родилась в 1955 в Таджикистане. Она с детства помогала родителям по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Бувинисо после замужества была вынуждена найти источник дохода, так как семья мужа жила крайне бедно. Она начала бизнес скотоводством. Вот уже 38 лет как она занимается скотоводством. Бувинисо имеет дополнительный доход от виноградарства. Бувинисо в основном откармливает мелко-рогатый скот. Бувинисо данное время имеет 12-15 голов МРС. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получить больше дохода. Бувинисо запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки МРС. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Buviniso was born in Tajikistan in 1955. From childhood, she helped her parents with their crop farming and cattle raising. After Buviniso got married, she needed to find a source of income as her husband's family lived on the edge of poverty. She started her own business of cattle breeding. For 38 years already, she has been practicing cattle breeding. Buviniso has an additional source of income from grape growing. Buviniso primarily fattens up sheep and goats. Buviniso currently has 12 to 15 sheep and goats. She wants to increase her working capital and, consequently, receive more earnings. Buviniso is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy sheep and goats. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Purisma

texts.en:
Purisma, 52 years old, is a widow and has five children. She has engaged in hog raising for eight years. At her age, she is a very hardworking mother because she wants to provide all the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy feed and additional piglets. 

Purisma dreams of seeing her children grow well and have good lives.

loans.use: to buy feed and two piglets

loans.name: Purisma

texts.en:
Purisma is a very diligent and loving person. She is 43 years old and married. She has engaged in a transportation business for three years. Her husband is the one who transports the motorcycle in the community. They both help each other to sustain the daily needs of their family. 

Purisma is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts for her business so that they may serve the customers well.

In the future, Purisma hopes that her business expands so that she can provide for all the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas is the father of three children who makes a living by owning and operating a general store. For more than a year, he has earned a good living this way, and has been able to provide for his family's needs and maintain his business. Tomas has successfully repaid a previous loan he took out and used for the business.To improve sales, he has requested a new loan to buy more goods to sell. In the future, he wants to buy a new motorcycle, because this will allow him to provide service to more customers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Shemiah

texts.en:
Shemiah is studying secondary education at Misamis University, Ozamiz City. She is single and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City with her family. Her father is a teacher and her mother worked as a private employee. 

Shemiah is determined and wants to finish her studies to have a bright future of her own. She is thankful to GDMPC's specialized student services for giving every student a chance to continue studying. Shemiah took a new loan recently to pay her tuition fees for the first semester of this year. She hopes to be successful and work hard in a good job.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Pedro Juan

texts.es: Pedro vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa de un familiar; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los granero que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en todas las zonas aledañas,  ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. Pedro  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his life partner and son in the house of a family member. He works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He has worked in this area for many years now and has gained a lot of valuable experience, which allows him to obtain the best harvests. The land he cultivates is located in a fertile area for agriculture. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granary shown in the photograph so that he can then sell it in all of the neighboring areas. He already has many steady customers who always prefer his products because of their quality and his affordable prices and unbeatable service.

Pedro would like to invest in agricultural inputs, but he needs capital. For this reason he is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizers, pest control, tools, etc. He has good payment references and is sure he will be able to pay off the debt on time. He is confident he will be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizers, pest control, tools, etc.

loans.name: Raja'

texts.en: Raja' is 32 years old, and lives with her husband and her four children, She sells hygienic home materials in her store, which she opened three years ago. Raja' applied for this loan to expand her business and make new decorations. All the neighbors prefer to buy from her because of her good treatment and good staff. Raja' is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand her business and make new decorations

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Aizha

texts.en:
Aizha is 54 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Aizha works very hard to provide for them.

Aizha runs a direct-sales Tupperware and Avon products business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Aizha has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Aizha would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios, es un pequeño productor de la zona rural del norte de Nicaragua. En su infancia logró concluir solamente sus estudios primarios, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres, pero esto no fue impedimento para que este hombre visionario saliera adelante. Reconoce el valor de los estudios, y a pesar de las dificultades económicas con las que se enfrenta día a día, transmite ese valor a su hijo mayor quien cursa primaria.   

Este visionario del café; se ha propuesto cultivar cafetos de calidad, y además, contar con un beneficio húmedo y patios de secado. La meta para este año es mejorar la nutrición de los cafetos, con lo que, la producción; y los ingresos para los 8 trabajadores temporales que son beneficiados por él. Para esto solicita un financiamiento.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is a small producer in rural northern Nicaragua. In his childhood he managed to complete only primary school, through the efforts of his parents, but this did not impede this visionary man from getting ahead in life. He recognizes the value of education, and in spite of the economic difficulties he faces day to day, he relays that value to his eldest son who is in elementary school.

This coffee visionary has proposed growing quality coffee trees and having a wet mill and drying yards. The goal for this year is to improve the nutrition of the coffee plants and with that the production; and the income for the 8 temporary workers who would benefit from it. For this, he is requesting financing.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj, 29 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has had a position of manager at an association of job providers since 2011. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. Their daughter goes to kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The electric car has advantages such as less fuel usage for travel and release of harmless pollutants. The borrower is going to use the electric car for transportation such as delivering his wife and daughter to the trade center and kindergarten, respectively.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity service in his home.

loans.name: Sedana Yoga Group

texts.en:
To improve their relationships and business progress, the Sedana Yoga group always exchanges information among members about the development of pig breeding. In group meetings, which are held once a month, they always exchange information so that they can raise pigs properly. The Sedana Yoga group has obtained this new larger loan. The members of the group are the same from the previous loan. The loan will be used for improving their pig businesses. 

By maintaining pigs for pig barbeque (“babi guling” in Bahasa), Ni Nengah earns a satisfactory profit. The profit is set aside for business capital and saving. By raising pigs, Ni Nengah is able to boost the economy and help the family income for the welfare of her family. Ni Nengah will use her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening and feed and to renovate a cage. The piglets will be sold 5 months later. Her daily needs come from her husband. Her husband works as a farmer and he is really happy for that. He supports his wife’s business by maintaining the pigs with feeding and washing the cage every afternoon. Ni Nengah and her husband hope that both their pig business and farming activities will succeed.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed and to renovate a cage.

loans.name: Nohemy  De Jesus

texts.es: Nohemy de 42 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de sandalias, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad, la calidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos  que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus hijos, Nohemy esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sandalia por mayor, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así ella y sus hijos puedan tener una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Nohemy is 42 years old and has worked for a number of years selling sandals. Her business is located in her house. She has many customers because of the variety and quality she offers and her good prices. She uses the money she earns to pay for household expenses. She lives in her own home with her children. Nohemy is requesting this loan to buy more sandals at wholesale prices. Her business is her only source of income, and she hopes to give her family better financial stability without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy sandals at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es: Mirna de 29 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra en la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora  vive con su hijo en casa propia. La clienta está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su hijo.
texts.en: Mirna is 29 years old and has worked in agriculture for a number of years growing beans and corn. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the sacks shown in the photograph so that she can then sell them. She uses the money she makes from her sales to pay household expenses. She is a responsible, honest and hardworking woman. She lives with her son in her own house. She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc. She does not currently earn enough to buy these items. She hopes to improve her income and her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his corn plants

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hijo y nieto. Sebastiana tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de verduras, carne y pescado   de forma ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar lo necesario a su familia. Sebastiana ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de forma que pueda seguir ofreciendo sus productos por mucho más tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará carne, pescado, pollo, tomates, papas, pipianes, etc. Espera poder aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Sebastiana, 55, lives at home with her spouse, son, and grandson. She has dedicated four years to selling vegetables, fish, and meat as an ambulant vendor. She is a hardworking woman who does everything that is within her reach to give her family what they need. Sebastiana has decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI to invest in her business so that she can continue to offer her products for much longer. With the amount requested, she will buy meat, fish, chicken, tomatoes, potatoes, pipian squash, and more. She hopes to increase sales and improve her profits in order to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, fish, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a farmer from Ozamiz City. She is twenty-five years old and married with two children. She and her husband work as farm laborers to support their family. 

She has requested a loan to buy farm inputs and fertilizer. She had this farming business for 4 years. 

Analiza hopes that she can save more for the future of her children and she also hopes that they can produce more products.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Mindanao

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn sells rice in her local area. She is 29 years of age yet still single. 

Jerlyn aims to have a progressive lifestyle someday but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 8,000 to be used for buying four sacks of rice. She also raises hogs as her additional source of income. 

Jerlyn hopes and prays that her rice-retailing and hog-raising businesses will grow continuously. In this way, she can earn greater income, which will be used for her basic needs in life.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married with 2 children. Gertrudes is 57 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Gertrudes owns a rice milling business. She has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns approximately 30,000 PHP. Gertrudes is a new member of PMPC. She reached out to PMPC for a loan to be used for rice milling maintenance and the renewal of her business permit. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for rice milling maintenance and business permit processing.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents. 

Ramel has been a teacher by profession for more than 20 years. He earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials to repair and renovate his mother’s house. Ramel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Ramel hopes to save more for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair and renovate his mother’s house.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is fifty-eight years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children, all of whom have now grown into adults.
 
Ernesto has operated a Funeral Home Service for six years and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month from doing this type of work. At present he is also engaged in a business buying and selling vehicles. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional accessories and materials for his coffin manufacturing business. Ernesto has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to expand his area of operation not only in Misamis Occidental but also to the neighboring Provinces in Mindanao.

loans.use: purchase additional accessories and materials for his coffin manufacturing business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married with four children. She operates a transportation business while her husband works on their own farm for a living. For more than eleven years in running a transportation business, Jocelyn was happy to say that this helps a lot to her family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy new tires to replace the old used tires on her motorcycle. In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace the old ones on her motorcycle.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 38 years old and has one children who is in school.

Arlene has a business directly selling cosmetics products in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional cartons of products to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cartons of products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Elvira has been in this business for 40 years. Elvira earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51 years old and married with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Daisy has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, fish, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Daisy has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, fish, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Marites is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Virginia has been in this business for 19 years. Virginia earns more income from food vending and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Duera

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Duera works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Duera is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

Duera has been sustaining her business activities using her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: A $800 loan is offered to Rosa to improve her business. She is married and lives in Ermera with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, including Fanta, Coca Cola, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, slippers and water. Rosa is generating a good income from selling items from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of experience.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Coca Cola, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, slippers and water

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 63-year-old businesswoman from Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City. 

She earns a living through her little sari-sari (convenience) store. This is how she supports her family. Fortunately, Lilian's store is located in a populous place where there is a good sales turn-out.  

In need of capital, she reached out to PMPC for a loan to purchase additional products to sell.

Lilian hopes that she can expand her business and save more for her future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with 5 children. She is 56 years old and lives in Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur.                       

Corazon is a farmer and grows palay and corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She requested a loan to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides.                                              

Corazon has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Corazon hopes to harvest more palay and corn products.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Hernanie

texts.en:
Hernanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell for her used clothes business.

Hernanie has been in this business for 4 years. Hernanie also earns income from pig-fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jeannilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear and plastic wares in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Jeannilyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her ready-to-wear and plastic wares business.

Jeannilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more additional stock to sell

loans.name: Santos Sergio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 37 años y es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una finca de 4.2 hectáreas, de las cuales 1.8 ha destinado para el cultivo de café, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Don Santos explica que en los últimos años la producción de su café ha pasado de 10 a 17 quintales oro, pero que su expectativa para el futuro es mejorar los rendimientos. Para lograr esta meta, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, y lograr así una mejor cosecha. Su deseo es aumentar sus ingresos y con ello poder brindar a su familia mejores condiciones para su futuro.
texts.en:
Santos is 37 years old and is a small producer of coffee who lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and 3 children on a farm of 4.2 hectares, 1.8 hectares are devoted to coffee. He grows it following the Fair Trade criteria.

Santos explains that in the past few years his coffee production has gone from 10 to 17 quintals of parchment coffee. He expects to increase these yields in the future. To achieve this goal he is requesting a loan which will permit him to buy the inputs and fertilizers that his plantation need to get a better harvest. His desire is to increase his income and provide his family with better conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy the inputs and fertilizers needed for his plantation.

loans.name: Elina Elizabeth

texts.es: Elina de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 6 hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Elina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elina is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her 6 children and her husband. For some years she has been in agriculture for a living, growing corn and beans. She sells her products in different markets near her place of residence, with which she obtains income. With the help of her husband they are able to cover the household expenses. Elina is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, etc., to be able to continue with her planting and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: G.s. La Holla Y El Comal Group

texts.es:
El g.s. La Holla y el Comal está conformado por seis integrantes madres solteras, con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la Paz Centro, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajara para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María y  tiene por actividad económica, la venta de ropa como pantalones, shores, faldas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, piyamas, ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas dirías ofreciendo su producto, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. g.s. la Holla  y el Comal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "La Holla y el Comal" communal bank is composed of six single mothers with 15 children under their responsibility. They are natives of La Paz Centro, a community that is located in the west of the country. They are hard-working, responsible and want to get ahead. In their spare time they like to enjoy them selves with their children. Unfortunately they could not study due to a lack of economic resources and had to work to help support the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort. and desire to improve, the coordinator is María She sells clothing such as pants, shorts, skirt, bedclothes, underwear and pajamas. She works 10 hours a day offering her product. The object of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the near future she can make more income. The "La Holla y el Comal" communal bank is grateful for the support given them by the lenders at Kiva who help people of low income in poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her store.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia, who is 38 years old, is happy tending her little store.  She is married and lives in Sindangan. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  She keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Anelia has reached her 4th year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan to pay for inventory like canned goods, noodles, laundry soap, and oil. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can remain a PMPC member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother who wishes to see the store succeed, and from those profits she can afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to pay for inventory like canned goods, noodles, laundry soap, and oil

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa de 62  años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación  personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, jeas, vestidos, faldas, short, camisetas, ropa de cama, toallas, ropa interior. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda  obtener mejores ingresos. Teresa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Teresa is 62 years old and is a native of el Sauce a community located in the north of the region. She is hard-working, responsible and has the desire for personal improvement. In her spare time she enjoys being in the company of her children. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources she could not study but had to work at an early age to help support the family economy.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead she sells new clothing like pants, jeans, dresses, shorts, blouses, bed-clothing, towels and underwear. She spends 10 hours a day offering her product so that in the near future she can make more money. Teresa thanks the lenders at Kiva for supporting people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business buying clothing.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín vive en el municipio de Entre Ríos, Trópico de Cochabamba, con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes aún dependen económicamente de él, trabaja dedicándose al área agrícola en su propio terreno donde cultiva yuca, plátano y arroz. En cuanto a su producción, vende a las comerciantes de fruta y otras personas que van al lugar donde se cosecha, el señor es una persona muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo por ello obtiene buenas cosechas, pero como sus ahorros los invirtió en la ampliación de su casa actualmente solicita un crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo de yuca para obtener mejores cosechas y generar mayores ingresos por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Agustín lives in the  municipality of Entre Ríos, Trópico de Cochabamba, with his wife and two children who depend on him economically. He work as a farmer on his own land where he grows yucca, plantains and rice. As for his harvest he sells to the fruit sellers and other people who come to the place where he grows. He is a very responsible man who is dedicated to his work. He produces good harvests but as he has invested the profits in expanding his house he needs to request a loan to maintain his yucca crops to get a better harvest and generate more income for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his yucca crops.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy feed and additional hogs for his piggery. His income from his business is assisting his everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs. He also has a variety store and an apartment for additional income.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan, for he will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs needed for his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Vicente dreams that his business will last longer and hopes that his family is always in good condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs for his business.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es:
María vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 4.2 hectáreas de las cuales 1.4 está destinadas a la producción de café, el cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo, ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, con lo cual está segura logrará una mayor productividad y mejores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando y seguir apoyándolos para que tengan mejores oportunidades que las que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
María lives together with her husband and their four children in a community in northern Nicaragua. Her farm is 4.2 hectares,1.4 of which is designated for the production of coffee, which operates under the criteria of Fair Trade certification.

For this cycle, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy the inputs to maintain her coffee plants, which is sure to achieve a higher productivity and better income for improving the conditions of her family.

Her dream is that her children can continue to study and she can continue helping them have better opportunities than she had.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame  MARIATOU est née vers 1974 à FONGATIE C/ YANFOLILA,  mère de 6 enfants, elle réside avec  son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à HAMDALLAYE un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Mariatou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités de fabrication de savon KABAKOUROUNI de façon traditionnelle. 
Elle achète des matières premières à SIKASSO plus des bois de chauffe achetés aux environnants de la ville de SIKASSO.
Après cette malaxage des matières premières pour donner un produit fini (KABAKOUROUNI) qui sera livré à la clientèle. Sa vente se fait à la maison et au marché où elle dispose une place fixe à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un quatrième prêt individuel. 
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des quantités importantes des matières premières et 4 chargements de camion de bois de chauffe.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mariatou was born around 1974 in Fongatie in Yanfolila Cercle. She lives with her husband and six children in a traditional family in Hamdallaye, a popular area in the city of Sikasso, which is in the third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.

After trying a number of businesses without success, Mariatou started making Kabakourouni soap in the traditional way. She buys her raw materials in Sikasso and firewood in the surrounding area. She then mixes the raw materials to produce the finished Kabakourouni, which she will deliver to her customers. She makes her sales from her home and in the market, where she has a fixed stall. She sells to men and women, for cash or credit.

To meet the ever-growing demand of her customers, she is requesting this loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. This is her fourth individual loan. This loan will allow her to buy significant quantities of raw materials and four truckloads of firewood. 

Mariatou expects to make an average monthly profit of 55,000 XOF, which she will use to pay off the loan and interest and add the rest to her savings.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make soap and four truckloads of firewood.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. Gina sells fish in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling food.

Gina is requesting her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mayerling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mayerling es una cafetalera de un pequeño, y alejado, pueblo del norte de Nicaragua. Junto a su esposo e hijo mayor; lleva 10 años trabajando en esta actividad agrícola. Con apenas 3.16 Ha. ha logrado certificación FLO y UTZ, produciendo un café de la mano con el medio ambiente y de calidad exportación. Brinda 15 empleos, temporales, a habitantes de su comunidad colaborando con economía de 5 familias, mejorando de esta forma el nivel de vida de sus coterráneos. 

Mayerling desea mejorar año con año su producción, esto a través de la buena nutrición brindada a su cafetos, de esta forma sus ingresos; y los de sus jornaleros, mejoraran. Para el cumplimiento de esta meta ella ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que acrecentarán su producción.
texts.en:
Mayerling is a coffee grower from a small, remote village in the north of Nicaragua. She lives with her husband and eldest child and has 10 years of experience working in this agricultural endeavor. With only 3.16 hectares (approx. 8 acres) of land, she has attained FLO (Fairtrade Labeling Organization) and UTZ (sustainable farming) certifications, producing export-quality, environmentally-friendly coffee.

She provides 15 temporary jobs to members of her community, contributing to the finances of five families, improving the standard of living of her neighbors. Mayerling hopes to improve her yield year to year by providing proper nutrition to her coffee plants, thus improving her income and that of her workers. To achieve her goal she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure which will increase her yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to increase her yield.

loans.name: Fernandita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Fernandita works hard to support her family.

She has a retail vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Fernandita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetable business.

Fernandita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar is 38 years old and  lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing spiritual services to local people at the monastery since 2007. His wife is a registrar at a state registration agency. 

He requests 3,000 USD to buy bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass to renovate his home. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Mario Cesar

texts.es: Mario de 44 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo desde hace 24 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su familia, Mario esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar el terreno donde desea sembrar que es el que muestra la fotografía y comprar los insumos necesarios como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario is 44 years old. He has been in agriculture for a living since he was 24 years old. His main crops are corn and beans. He markets in the surrounding area. With his sales he covers some of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his family. Mario is requesting a loan to improve the soil where he wants to plant, which is in the photo shown. He wants to buy the necessary inputs like seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. and in this way continue with his work that generates good income, and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Erdenetuya

texts.en:
Mrs.Erdenetuya, 41 years old, lives with her husband and son in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as a dispatcher at a railroad company since 1991. Her husband works at a private company which supplies stone and sand to the local market. Their son is a security officer and works at a security company. 

Erdenetuya is requesting a loan of MNT 3,800,000 to buy building materials for house renovation, such as bricks, planks, and cement. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy education equipment and pay tuition fee

loans.name: Jose Ramon
