texts.es: Jose Ramón mayor de edad casado con dos hijos el cual uno esta aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios del norte de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Jose se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario el cual tiene dos tipos de negocio que consiste en transporte de tres triciclo con el que brinda el servicio de transporte interurbano y una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, huevos, productos congelados, golosinas, leña, jugos, sardinas, cosméticos, bolsitas de shampoo, rinse, jabón, pamperes, afeitadoras, medicamentos como: dolofin, anticimicinas, panadol, tabcin, alka selser, entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza en mercados de la zona y en distribuidoras y son al contado, sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio para brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes, Jose Ramón esta solicitando nuevamente un financiamiento para invertir en la pulperia en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar y tener variedades de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Jose esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrecen a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose Ramon is married with two children, one of which is still under his responsibility. He is from one of the municipalities of northern chinandega located in the west of the country.

Jose is known for being a hardworking, responsible man with a desire for self-improvement.
He is a small business owner who has two types of business that involves three tricycle transport which provides inter-city transport service and a small grocery store which offers household consumer products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, eggs, frozen food, candy, firewood, juices, sardines, cosmetics, bags of shampoo, conditioner, soap, diapers, razors, and over the counter medicines. 

His purchases are made in area markets and distributors, sales are conducted in cash and credit for permanent and temporary customers.

He begins his workday very early opening the doors of his business so as to provide better service to his customers.
Jose Ramon is again requesting a loan to invest in the grocery store when buying consumer products for the home and to a have varieties of products to offer his customers. Jose is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors offer low income people.

loans.use: to purchase consumer products for the grocery store such as rice, beans, frozen food, candy, firewood, cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age. 

She is engaged in fish-vending with the support of her husband who is a fisherman. Angelina earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of fish for resale. 

Angelina has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish-vending business.

loans.use: purchase additional kilos of fish for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice. After many years of farming, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is widowed with four children.                           

Marina has a shop that sells rice and grocery items. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to pay for sacks of rice and grocery items.                                                             

Marina has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for five sacks of rice and grocery products

loans.name: Nefelonbert

texts.en: Nefelonbert is earning an income by providing transportation services in his community. He has been able to support the needs of his three children. Over the four years he has been running the business, he has earned well to support his family's daily expenditures and was able to sustain the business. To maintain his services, he took a new loan to buy new tires to replace the old used tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the quality of life he wants to provide for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
This is Saturnino, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Dolores, a housewife, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Saturnino operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Saturnino hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams that his child will finish college. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is 34 years old and married. She works hard to support her family.

Elnora has a gowns rental business in the Philippines and also earns income from tailoring. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy cloth and other dressmaking materials for her gowns rental business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Elnora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other dressmaking materials for her business

loans.name: Rubelinda

texts.en:
Rubelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials  for her fishing business.

Rubelinda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Henrry Antonio

texts.es:
Henry, caficultor desde hace 10 años, trabaja una finca, de 2.81 Ha., bajo la certificación FLO y sueña con heredar el amor a la caficultura a sus hijos. En su finca provee 12 empleos temporales a 6 familias de su comunidad. 
Henry se enorgullece de ser partícipe de productores que cosechan un café de exportación. Esto es el motor que mueve su afán por producir con calidad y así ser un ejemplo orgulloso para sus hijos. 

Su pequeña finca cuenta con un beneficio, con el que ha mejorado la cosecha de sus cafetales, y sus ingresos. Con el fin de una mejora continua ha decidido invertir en la nutrición de sus cafetos, por lo que, solicita un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le ayuden a cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Henry , farmer of 10 years, works a 2.81 hectare farm, which operates under the fairtrade certification. He dreams of leaving the love of coffee culture to his children. On his farm he has 12 temporary employees from 6 families in his community.
Henry is proud to be a participant in the production and harvest of coffee for export. This is the motor that drives his eagerness to produce with quality and be a proud example for his children.
His small farm comes with a benefit, with which he has improved his coffee crop harvest and his income. With the goal of continuous improvement, he has decided to invest in the nutrition of his coffee plants, for which he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure that help him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtaivan, 57 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at a high school, where his wife also works. He and his wife also breed pigs and grow vegetables for a living. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years due to strong storms and heavy snowfalls. So Enkhtaivan is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovations. After the renovations, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and thus fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica desde hace 1 año a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su lugar de residencia, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en casa de un familiar. La clienta  solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower has worked for a year making and selling tortillas from her place of residence. She works Monday through Sunday, and she has many customers. She is a hardworking and kind person. With her earnings, she helps with her family's expenses. She lives with her parents and siblings in the house of a relative.

The borrower is requesting a loan through Integral to purchase corn by the quintal [46 kg, about 100 lb.] to continue making tortillas, so that she can earn more income to have a greater level of economic stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the quintal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and purchase education equipment.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramon de 67 años de edad, casado sin hijos menores de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar sus estudios, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.  Actualmente sigue luchando para poder mantener su negocio  estable, y  su fuente de ingresos para subsistir.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica el servicio de reparación de bicicleta y venta de repuestos. El dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra repuestos de bicicleta y material de trabajo como: rines, llantas, aceite, rayos, neumáticos, parches, pega, asientos, pedales, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Juan Ramon agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon is 67 years old and married with grown children. He is originally from Leon, located in the west of the country. Juan Ramon is known for being hardworking, responsible, and eager to self-improve. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources he could not pursue his studies and had to work to help with household expenses. He is currently still striving to maintain his stable business and income to survive.

Thanks to his effort and desire to succeed, he owns bicycle repair service and sells spare parts. He works about eight hours a day offering his services. The business is located in his home. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and buy bike parts and materials such as wheels, tires, oil, spokes, tires, patches, paste, seats, and pedals, so that he can increase his income in the near future. Juan Ramon thanks the lenders at Kiva for supporting people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: for working capital to buy materials for his bicycle repair business such as wheels, tires, oil, spokes, tires, patches, paste, seats, and pedals.

loans.name: Coney

texts.en:
This is Coney. She is 32 years old and married with one kid. She has managed a sari-sari store (community based store) for five years. She is a very hardworking person. She loves to serve her family well and makes sure that she can provide all the needs of her family. 

Every morning she is the one who opens the store, because her store is very in-demand in their community. Her husband Ciriaco is a simple farmer in the community. Coney hopes someday she can build their own house, so that she can increase their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and spices for her business

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is married and has three children. He operates a business to buy and sell motorcycles to make a living.  He has done this for more than ten years and he makes a good income. 

His generated income from the business helps him to make improvements to his business and he had successfully repaid his previous loan.

He took a new loan recently to cover the cost of business permits and licenses . He wants to improve his business and is hope to buy another unit for the family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy and sell motorcycles.

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en:
Jurenda, a mother of four children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For ten years, the couple earned well to provide for the family. She had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future, she wants to provide good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
This is Melchor, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Aisa, a housewife, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melchor operates a retail business where he sells different kinds of slippers. He also has a Jeepney (a type of transport vehicle) for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and members of the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, Melchor is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy slippers for men, women and children.

Melchor dreams of expanding his business and hopes to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy slippers to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 31-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and also groceries. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are small-scale customers. She states her biggest business challenge to be scarcity of products. 

Anita will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes and groceries. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and groceries

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 44-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps livestock. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor weather conditions. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more livestock to resell. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel in everything. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to resell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 40-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a construction business where he constructs houses. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of customers. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy building materials. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 46-year-old widowed mother of four, describes herself as visionary. She operates a farm, located in a fertile and ideal place, where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. In business for 10 years, her biggest challenge are low prices. 

Agnes will use this Kes 20,000 loan, her first with SMEP DTM, to buy animal feeds and pay for farm labor costs. Her goal is to be a successful dairy farmer within five years.

loans.use: buy animal feeds and pay for farm labor costs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 62-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being visionary. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. She also grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fertile and ideal place and her primary customers are individual customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. 

Alice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and to pay farm labor costs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. This is Alice's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay farm labor costs.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is married woman with two children and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income growing rice.  Marisol is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase canned goods, egg,s milk, and sugar for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Marisol has sustained her business activities through her  6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is  to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, egg, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cristy has been in this business for 18 years. Cristy earns additional income raising pigs.

She is borrowing  20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase gasoline, a fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, a fishing net, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jonadil

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jonadil works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Jonadil is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requested a new loan to further build her business.

Jonadil has sustained her business activities through 15 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from poultry. Editha is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and soap

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Cipriana has been in this business for six years. Cipriana earns more income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

Cipriana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Olivia De Jesus

texts.es:
Olivia tiene 53 años y desde hace más de 30 años, se dedica a la producción de café. Vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su pequeña finca de 17 hectáreas, de las cuales 11 son dedicadas al cultivo de café y el cual maneja bajo las normas de certificación de comercio justo.

Esta pequeña emprendedora es la que se encarga de la administración de su finca y junto a su esposo le han venido dando un buen manejo a sus plantaciones, que ha resultado en un incremento del 25% en su producción en los últimos tres años. 

Su expectativa ahora es combatir eficientemente las enfermedades que afectan el café y continuar aumentando su cosechar para obtener mejores ingresos. Para esto, ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su café en este ciclo.

Su sueño es hacer que su finca sea un modelo de productividad en la zona donde habita y  que sus hijos puedan tener una buena base para su futuro.
texts.en:
Olivia is 53, she has worked producing coffee for more than 30 years.  She lives with her husband and five children at their small ranch of 17 hectares, of which 11 are used as coffee plantation and is managed according to fair trade certification. 

This small entrepreneur is in charge of managing her ranch and with her husband they have been able to do a good job managing their plantation, which has resulted in 25% production increase in the past three years.

Her expectations now are to fight the pests that affect coffee and to continue increasing harvesting to obtain more income.
To achieve this, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to guarantee maintenance activities for her coffee this season.

Her dream is to make of her ranch a role model of productivity in the zone where she lives and that her children can have a good base for the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin earns a living from selling goods in her retail store. For three years, Jasmin has earned well and sustained the business. She had also buys some home improvements like appliances. 

She had competitors in the village but she  had her loyal customers who visited her store and made some purchases.  With her generated income, her previous loan used in buying corn grits was successfully repaid. To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell.She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 21 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración y venta de quesadillas y tamales, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su casa, vive con sus hermanos y sus tíos en casa de un familiar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como harina, levadura, azúcar, latas, moldes, verduras, pollo, maíz, etc. y mejorar el lugar donde comercializa que es el que muestra en la fotografía, ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poder seguir ayudando en su casa para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
This client is 21 years old and has worked making and selling quesadillas and tamales for 3 years. Her business is located near her home, and has many customers due to her kind service and good prices. She uses her income from sales to help with home expenses; She lives with her siblings and uncles in a family member’s house. 

The client is requesting a loan to purchase necessary ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, tins, molds, vegetables, chicken, corn, etc. and to improve her salesplace which is shown in the picture. This is her only source of income and the loan will allow her to continue to help at home and to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, tins, molds, vegetables, chicken, corn, etc. and to improve her sales place

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 52 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children now in their adult age. 

Jimmy has been engaged in an agricultural activity, specifically banana production, for 11 years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase an additional five sacks of commercial fertilizers for her existing banana production activity.
 
Jimmy has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Jimmy hopes to expand her banana production activity.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of commercial fertilizer

loans.name: Alina Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Alina, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y son su compañía.
Doña Alina es una mujer que le gusta valerse por si misma, ella toda la vida le ha gustado trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora sigue trabajando para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual construyó un pequeño corral en su casa, también se dedica a la venta de ropa y una a dos veces por mes compra chanchos y los hace faenar y distribuye la carne por libras, esto le deja muy buenos ingresos cuando lo realiza. Así ella siempre se ha ganado el sustento diario para ella y sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar alimento para los pollos y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Cristo Resucitado (Risen Christ) meet in the Libertad #2 neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known as the city of royal tamarinds for many years.

This is where a woman named Alina lives. She is 50 years old, a single mother to four adult children, two of whom still live in her home with her.

Alina is a woman that likes to support herself, she has enjoyed working her whole life to support her children and now she continues working to get ahead. She makes a living raising chickens for which she built a small pen in her house. She also sells clothing and one to two times per month she buys pigs for slaughter and she distributes the meat per pound. This gives her a very good income when she does it. This is how she has always supported herself and her children each day.

She will spend this loan by purchasing food for the chickens and various types of clothing. She has been in the community bank since it began and she enjoys it because the loans help her out a lot. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and clothing.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 21-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the temporary business premise. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, a 34-year-old married mother of two, describes herself as visionary and focused. Ann operates a farm where she grows vegetables and keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. In operation for five years, her business is located in a fertile place, and her primary customers are individuals. Her biggest challenge is a lack of finances. 

Ann will use this Kes 20,000 loan, her first with SMEP DTM, to buy seedlings and pay for labor costs. Her business goal is to be a successful  farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a resale coconut business in the Philippines and earns additional income from from a nipa roofing business. 

Analiza is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy coconuts.

Analiza has sustained her business activities through 5 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconuts.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables, eggs, meat, fish, and spices for her restaurant business.

Juliet has been in this business for 6 years. Juliet earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Juliet has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, eggs, meat, fish, and spices.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 31-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming and her primary customers are hotels. 

Joyce describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farming inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming inputs

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 35 years old and married with two children.

Edwina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, etc.

She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut.

Edwina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marichu works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Marichu is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock to sell like chips, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, etc for her general store business.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like chips, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, etc

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, spices, noodles, and coffee.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from making vinegar.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, spices, noodles, and coffee.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is a 41-year-old woman.  She is uneducated because her parents were not able to provide her with an education due to their economic situation. She is married to Bimal, who is 49 years old and also illiterate.  She has three children (two sons and one daughter).  All are students and in grade 11, grade 10 and grade 8.  They live in their own house in Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.

Rekha is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer. At a very young age, he started working with agriculture because his family has been cultivating different vegetables for generations.  He inherited the land from his parents.  Rekha and her husband work together to improve their family's well-being.  This business is the only source of income for their family, but it is hardly sufficient to cover the household expenses of a family of five members.

Rekha dreams of giving her children a quality life.  She wants to provide them with the opportunity to study so that they can develop and become successful in future, so she needs to expand their business. They have decided to cultivate jute, which is a very profitable crop, so she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.  She wants to utilize the loan to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers.

She hopes that it will be a lucrative business which will ensure good revenue to overcome their financial hurdles.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Monowara

texts.en:
Monowara is 43, married, a housewife and a loving mother of four sons. Two of them are grown up and unemployed. Two are in school and in grade 7 and 2.  Monowara and her husband, Abubokkor, are illiterate and can sign their names only. They live in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Monowara's husband is fully associated with agricultural activities. He works hard on his farmland from dawn to dusk and produces vegetables, mainly potatoes. He always tries to produce quality vegetables in order to satisfy his customers.  

Monowara is a very feisty and enterprising woman, who helps her husband in sowing and harvesting crops. One of their sons is also engaged in this business. He helps to carry the produce to the market for sale. However, it is still a limited income to cover different household costs, such as food, clothing and education. Thus, they decided to cultivate jute, which is much in demand and a profitable crop in their area.

Monowara has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase seeds, fertilizers, etc.

Monowara’s goals and plans for the future are to improve their agribusiness in order to improve their family's economy and to use the profits to give her sons a good education.

She appreciates the support of her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase necessary agricultural supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, etc., to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
At first, Zebo helped her mother to manage a clothing sales business. Then she organized her own business. Zebo has been busy with selling women’s clothing for more than fifteen years. She sells women’s dresses, blouses, skirts, shawls, etc. 

Zebo is only breadwinner for herself because she is widowed and has no children. Her husband died some years ago. She always wanted to have children. Zebo also plans to sell children’s clothing because she loves children. 

Every season she renews the assortment of her goods. Zebo is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy women’s clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en:
Muazzam, a kind and smart woman, is a loving wife and careful mother of three children. She has a medical education and is a nurse in a local hospital. 

To supplement her small salary, Muazzam began an animal husbandry business a year ago, selling cattle in a local market. Her profits are slowly improving her family's living conditions. 

Muazzam wants to repair her house, which is currently in bad condition. She is therefore requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. Muazzam awaits your support, which she is confident will contribute to improved living standards for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. to repair her house

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Jinalyn is happily married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). The couple have been blessed with two children. Jinalyn's elder child goes to school while her younger child is still an infant.

Jinalyn plans to purchase more grocery items such as condiments, soft drinks, assorted biscuits and canned goods, but her capital is not sufficient. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes that she can obtain this amount in order to earn more income to feed her family and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as condiments, soft drinks, assorted biscuits and canned goods

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children now at their adult age.

Alicia has been engaged in a sow raising and breeding activity with the help of her husband for 30 years already. Alicia earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional five sacks of lactating and grower feeds for her sow raising and breeding activity.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her sow raising and breeding business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional five sacks of lactating and grower feeds

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 22-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of shoes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of shoes

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a 40-year-old widow. She has been blessed with four children; Anggriani, 20, in college; Septianti, 17, Senior High School; Bella, 12, Junior High School; and the last one is Marben, 5, in early childhood education. 

Marta has been running a kiosk business for two years in her house, but there are many competitors near her house. This situation led her to move her kiosk to an area near her sister’s house, about 20 km from her house. 

In fact, Marta can generate more income in the new place. She is selling daily needs such as shampoo, detergent, soap, instant cooking spices, soft drinks, etc. Currently, she has to pay her daughter's education fees, but unfortunately she does not have enough cash to do so. She applied for a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be used for paying her daughter's education fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's education fees

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be a go-getter. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. 

Jason will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a businesswoman from Lawis, Sindangan. She is married and a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

Loreta has a shop that sells assorted groceries, and has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan to pay for additional assorted groceries.

She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to sustain her sari sari business into a mini grocery store.

loans.use: to pay for additional assorted groceries.

loans.name: Acram

texts.en:
Acram is a 28-year-old single man living with his family in a rented house in Hodeidah, Yemen. He studied until elementary school. Due to the miserable condition of his family, Acram couldn't complete his studies. He didn't surrender to his condition, but he strives to provide his family with a better life. Acram decided to work as a barber in one of the barbershops of the city. From this business, he became a professional young man. He could accumulate a good amount of money, and then he started his own business by opening a barbershop in the center of the city of Hodeidah. Recently, he has run this business very well. He thinks his business goes forward because he loves what he does. The climate in Hodeidah is very hot in most of the seasons of the year, particularly in these days. Unfortunately, Acram's barbershop lacks an air conditioner. This negatively affects the attraction of more customers. Also, Acram wants to purchase a glass door for the store in order to make the barbershop very attractive for more customers. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase an air conditioner and glass door for his barbershop.

Acram is looking forward to expanding his business through opening another barbershop beside the first one.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner and glass door for his barbershop.

loans.name: Maria Eusevia

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad, es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Maria desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old. She is very responsible and her top priority is to support her family. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has a business selling tortillas, which she makes every afternoon and evening. Her business is located in her home. Maria is very eager to improve her business, as it provides a stable income, allowing her to support her family. 

This is why she is applying for a loan which she will use to buy wholesale corn and lime powder, which will enable her to make more tortillas. She sees increased demand, especially on weekends, because many other tortilla makers are closed. With this loan she can earn more which will improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime powder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Batik clothes

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat was born in 1960. She is divorced and has a daughter who is an adult. Salomat is going to start a business because she needs income. She wants to start a business selling children's clothes. With the goal of starting her own business, she took a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She thinks that her business will go well because children's clothes are in great demand in the local market. Salomat is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy children's clothes for her new business. She is going to improve her living condition from the profits. She awaits your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn spends her time each day selling dry goods in the market. She sells clothes and shoes. While managing her business, Marilyn is also improving her selling skills to approach more customers, which will help her earn a better income. Marilyn wants to borrow a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. She will use her earnings to support her family needs, particularly her children's education. She is doing her best to grow the business and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.en:
Rayhona is a young and kind woman. She is divorced and has no children. Rayhona lives with her mother. 

After returning to her mother’s house, Rayhona began a business deal. Her uncle helped her to organize a business. 

For more than four years, Rayhona has been busy, processing and selling dried fruit. She has an apricot garden. She collects apricots, processes them, and sells them in a local market where there is great demand for this kind of dried fruit. 

Rayhona needs to financial support now because she is going to buy dried fruit to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of TJS 3,000 (somoni) to buy dried fruit. She awaits your support. 

From the profit of her business, Rayhona wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Dolores Eulalia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de  edad, una de sus  hijos aun  vive en su casa. Su marido es chofer.
Doña Dolores es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja casi todos los  días, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Su hija le ayuda con su negocio ya que ella a veces no puede salir. Lleva más de 6 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante y ayuda a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Libertad # 2 in the city of Portoviejo -- the capital de Manabí province, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds" -- the members of the Cristo Resucitado (Risen Christ) Communal Bank hold their meetings. 

This is where Dolores lives.  She is 46 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She and her husband have two grown children, one of whom still lives with them. Her husband is a driver and Dolores is a housewife. To have her own income she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, makeup, perfume and accessories for women). She sells door-to-door and she works nearly every day, selling on credit and collecting every week or twice a month, depending on the wishes of her customers. Sometimes Dolores cannot go out, so her daughter helps with the business. Dolores has been doing this for six years and it has allowed her to get ahead and to help her husband with household expenses.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, and costume jewelry. She is a founding member of this communal bank and she is pleased with it because they offer her loans. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 33-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be visionary and focused. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile place, and her primary customers are individual customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and pay for farm labor. 

Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en: Dancan is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be a go-getter. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a bus within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming citrus fruits. Nelly is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned  goods, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested additional loan to further build her business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned  goods, etc

loans.name: Subarna

texts.en:
Subarna is a rural woman of 40 years from the village Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  Her son is a mason and her daughter is a student in grade 12.  Her husband Rajkumar, aged 40 years, is engaged in agriculture.  Both are uneducated and can only sign their names. They have a kachha house (made of wood, mud, straw and bamboo).

Subarna’s husband works in agriculture and earns his income selling the crops in the local markets.  He has an ancestral plot of land where he grows potatoes, beans, eggplant etc. on a crop rotation basis.  He has ten years' experience in the sector.  But these days it has become difficult to maintain his family with his small income, when the prices of essential goods are increasing by leaps and bounds.  So Subarna and her husband have decided to grow a profitable crop like jute in their farmland. For this, they need financial support.

Subarna came to know about BJS ( Kiva's partner) and has taken a loan from them to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers to cultivate jute in the next planting season.  She hopes this will increase her crop production and thus give additional profit.

Her dreams are to give a proper education to her daughter, strengthen the family economy, and save money for the future construction of a concrete-made house for them.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for lending her the money.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Divino Niño Sauce Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Divino niño Sauce está conformado por seis mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables de quince hijos. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Yamilet y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, gaseosas, jabón, detérgete. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Divino Niño Sauce agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Niño del Sauce Communal Bank is made up of six women and two men, responsible mothers and fathers of 15 children.  They come from Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the region.  They are known for being hardworking and responsible and for having a drive to better themselves personally.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to attend school and instead had to start working at a young age to help with the household expenses.  They currently work day after day to offer their children a better future.  

Thanks to her efforts and drive to get ahead, Yamilet is the coordinator and her business is a pulpería, which is small store that sells food items in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, soft drinks, soap, and detergent.  Her intent for this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying food products, so that in the near future she will be able to increase her profits.  Divino Niño Sauce is thankful for the help Kiva's lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can do honest work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying and selling food items, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, soft drinks, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con sus hijos en casa propia su esposo residen en estados unidos y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Maria  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella  ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Forty-one-year-old María is very kind and hardworking.  She lives with her children in her own home; her husband lives in the United States and he helps her with the household expenses.  She works very hard on her own plot where she grows corn and beans; her produce is very good quality and when her harvest is ready she stores it in granaries like the one shown in the photograph so she can go out and sell it in the different markets close to her home.  María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so she can have the money she needs to invest in farming supplies, such as pest control, fertilizers, manures, and seeds, among other things she needs for her crop.  She is eager to increase her sales so she will see better profits and offer her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control, fertilizers, manures, and seeds, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 19 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su compañera de vida, él se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos como: maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy decidido a luchar por sus sueños, se siente satisfecho y muy cómodo con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio,  por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The 19-year-old client lives in the home of a family member with his partner. He works in his mill, processing all kinds of food such as corn, beans, flour, and sauces. He has had this business for some time already and has a wide range of experience which helps him to generate a very good income. He is very well-known in the area and has built up a great clientele that prefers his business for his accessible prices and unrivalled service. He is always at his customers' service. He is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work and to fighting for his dreams. He feels satisfied and very comfortable with his business. In the past few weeks demand for his services has increased, so he has requested a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy blades, discs, and all the tools necessary for having a good mill. This way, he will continue with his work and have a greater quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, and all the necessary tools.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda has been running her piggery for more than seven years, and she earns well for the needs of her five children and the entire family. Her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for her piggery has been successfully repaid through her generated revenue. Currently, she is taking a new loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. She wants to expand her business, and dreams of seeing her children finish their studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a 66-year-old, married woman who has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in seasons. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells oranges and mangoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Scholastica describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is a single woman who has one child. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential place and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Karina Beatriz

texts.es:
Karina tiene 32 años de edad y trabaja como enfermera en un hospital de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para solventar su hogar, sobre todo porque es madre de un hijo de 6 años a quien quiere mucho y por quien se esfuerza cada día para poder brindarle una vida mejor.

Karina esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar artefactos electrodomésticos y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, asi ella podrá seguir trabajando para poder salir adelante y poder luchar por su gran sueño:” Tener su propia clínica”.
texts.en:
Karina is 32 years old and she works as a nurse at a hospital in her city.  This provides her with income to support her household, above all because she is the mother of a six-year-old boy whom she loves very much and for whom she works every day to be able to offer him a better life.  

Karina is thankful to Kiva's lenders as it is thanks to the help they have offered her that she will be able to buy household appliances, which will allow her to improve her quality of life so she can keep working to be able to get ahead and work toward her greatest dream:  having her own clinic.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man, and he has two children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a barbershop where he shaves hair. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are male. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair-cutting machine. He hopes that in the future, he will have a self-sustainable business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a hair-cutting machine.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 31 years old and a resident of Vivekananda Para in the district Jalpaigiri.  She is married,   a housewife and mother of four children. Two of them are students in grades 7 and 4, and two are below school-going age.  Sunita studied up to grade 8 and could not continue further due to her family's poor economic resources. Her husband Jagadish, aged 56 years, is uneducated and can sign his name only. He is associated with a business of repairing utensils.

Sunita's husband works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses, but his business is not going well.  Sunita also helps her husband, while managing the household.

Sunita is engaged in a cosmetics and soft toy business to help her husband financially.  She sells different cosmetics and soft toys to her neighbors and in the nearby village.

Now she wants to expand her business.  She has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase soft toys and inexpensive items and toiletries such as cosmetics, shampoo, soap, hair oil, etc.  Her neighbors are her regular customers and she will sell her products in the local community. She hopes to have a good profit from her business and wants to improve it in future for a more secure life.

She is thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase varieties of cosmetics and soft toys for her existing business.

loans.name: Rasida

texts.en:
Rasida is only 20 years old, energetic and has the courage to go ahead in life. She is married to Sahibul, 25 years old. Together they are raising only one son, who is too young to attend school. Both Rasida and her husband received primary education. They live in a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Rasida’s husband is associated with a small business and has no consistent income.  Rasida is a housewife. So, it is hardly possible for her to maintain a family with her husband's small income.  

Rasida is hardworking and optimistic. She keeps faith in her own ability. So, she wants to do some income-generating activity on her own. She has decided to practice livestock breeding in order to give financial support to her husband. She wants to start the business by purchasing one cow and selling milk to her neighbors.

With this determination, she turned to BJS (Kiva 's partner). She is requesting a loan from BJS to purchase a cow. She wants to start her business in order to fundamentally increase her family's income. 

Later, she wants to increase the number of her livestock to get a steady income. She dreams to see her son be established in life. She also aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them with the profit from her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 44 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom are in school. Ofelia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Ofelia has been in this business for 21 years. 

In the future Ofelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti is a rural woman from the village Gosairhat in Jalpaiguri district.  She is married to Ranjan and together they are rearing five children (four sons and one daughter).  Their eldest son works abroad.  The four other children are students in grades  7, 3, 2, and 1. Both Suniti and her husband are uneducated because of their parents' poor economic resources.

Suniti's husband is 42 years old.  He is very friendly and a hard worker.  He works very hard in his land and grows different vegetables and fruit, such as potatoes, eggplant, beans, cucumbers, etc. His produce is of very high quality and he sells it in different markets that are close to his home.  Suniti also works as a laborer on daily wages to help the family economically, yet they are unable to cover all the expenses of such a large family.

Suniti is asking for the loan from BJS as they have decided to cultivate jute in their farmland.  They have chosen this crop as it has a good demand in the present market and is a profitable crop, too.  The money is needed to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticides and manure.  Suniti is eager to increase her sales so that she can earn more income and give her family better economic stability.

She wants to give better education to her children so that they can be established in life.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Joel Mauricio

texts.es: Joel de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, hace 8 años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Joel es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando para tener junto con su familia una mejor vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Joel, who is 38 years old, lives with his wife and their children. Some 8 years ago, he managed to establish a little store in his place of residence and, thanks to God and his arduous work and dedication, the business is now quite well recognized in the zone and can count on a large clientele.

For Joel, it is very important to keep his store active since it is his principal source of income. He has decided to solicit this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in purchasing merchandise for the store, including eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet pastries, and other articles that seem attractive to customers. 

In this manner, Joel hopes to achieve his dream of keeping his store active and, as a consequence, to continue working to have with his family, a better life without some limitations.

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet pastries and other articles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 18 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace algunos  años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros asi como muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su abuela, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: This 18-year-old client has worked in farming for several years and this has given him the ability and knowledge to tend to his crops.  His main crops are corn and beans; when his harvest is ready he stores it in granaries like the one shown in the photograph to then sell them to agencies that buy and sell staple grains close to his home.  With the earnings from his sales he helps with his family's expenses.  He lives with his grandmother.  He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies that will help him plant his crops, such as manures, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and thus have better earnings and keep helping with his household's expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy manures, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.es: Amparo de 63 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propios hogares. Amparo es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en cual consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. El negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia. Ha decidido invertir en su negocio en la compra de artículos de tienda al por mayor, con el fin de atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar sus niveles de ventas e ingresos. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Amparo is 63 years old and lives in her own home.  Her children are already grown and have their own homes.  Amparo is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  A few years ago she decided to set up a small business consisting of a small store that she has maintained over the course of several years through hard work and dedication.  She has a lot of clientele, as customers are the most important thing to her; she always serves them with a smile and great kindness, which is why she has earned the trust of many people in the area, in addition to the fact that she always has what her customers are looking for.  Her business is located in her home.  She has decided to invest in her business by buying products for her store wholesale with the goal of attracting more customers and thus improving her sales and earnings numbers.  For this reason she decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to be able to invest in her small store and stock it with all kinds of products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent, and other products that attract her customers.  She is confident that this is the way to achieve her dream of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent, and other products

loans.name: Alexis Nohemy

texts.es: Alexis tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos de 14 años, 13 años, 11 años, 3 años y 1 años de edad. Alexis se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y cereales de forma ambulante en el mercado central de su localidad. Alexis es una mujer emprendedora y carismática quien ha sabido ganarse a muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más por ofrecer productos frescos y a muy buenos precios. Alexis desea invertir en su negocio por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de frutas, verduras y cereales (sandias, melones, jocotes, mangos, rábanos, maíz, frijoles y maicillo). De esta forma espera mejorar sus ingresos y de igual forma sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alexis is 31 and lives in her own home with her partner and five children ages 14, 13, 11, 3, and 1.
Alexis sells fruit, vegetables, and grains in the central market. She is an enterprising and charismatic woman who has been able to gain many clients who like her business more every day because she offers fresh products at very good prices.
Alexis would like to invest in her business, so she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a variety of fruits, vegetables, and grains (watermelons, melons, jocotes, mangos, radish, corn, beans, and sorghum).
Through this loan she hopes to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and grains (watermelons, mango, jocotes, radish, corn, beans, and sorghum).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, and purchase education equipment.

loans.name: Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Mery, who is aged in her early thirties, is married and has got a boy and a girl who are at school. She has been a genge mother selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. Mery runs her business from 07 am to 09 pm per working and is able to make a fair monthly return. 

Mery is requesting for her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetable and small shop items to resell. Mery hopes that soon her genge will grow to the gengeduka level (general store), selling fruits, vegetables and rice, maize flour, sugar, salt, baking flour, matchboxes and soft drinks. In the coming years Mery would like to improve her family's life by building a house. 
She will share this loan with her loan group" MSAKUZI", which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetable and small shop items to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron and scraps.

loans.name: Buyuni Tazara Group

texts.en:
