Ashura, who is early thirties, is a mother of two school age children, a boy and a girl. She is married and has been managing two businesses in the same room which she has rented for 3 years now. She has a shop selling Muslim type of dresses (madila) and cosmetics. Ashura opens her shop from 08 am to 07 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her sixth loan, which she will use to buy a fridge so as to sell soft drinks and buy dresses for resale. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, Ashura used to rent her current business place, bought shop stocks of dresses and cosmetics. She managed to make a profit, which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. In the coming years, Ashura would like to own a big shop selling more popular items. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" BUYUNI", which totals 5 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy a fridge so as to sell soft drinks and buy dresses for resale.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks and cakes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are travelers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in season. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more drinks and cakes. His business goal is to own a large retail store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stocks of drinks and cakes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a convenient location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Cruz Esperanza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella, uno  estudian en universidad. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Cruz es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus ingresos cubrir los gastos de los estudios de su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Oriflame, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja cuatro días más que todo en las horas de la mañana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito  y cobra semanalmente. Los productos que más vende son los perfumes y los maquillajes.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y maquillaje. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápido sin tantos trámites. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the Cristo Resucitado [Christ Resurrected] Group meet in the area of Libertad # 2 of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds. 
Cruz lives in this place. She is 58, married, and has 5 grown children, three of whom still live with her. One of her children is in university. Her husband is a master builder.
Cruz is a woman who likes to take care of herself and pay for her child's studies from her income. She sells Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works four days per week, mostly in the mornings. She sells door-to-door and on order. She leaves her products on credit and charges weekly.
The products she sells most of are the perfumes and makeup.
This loan is for the purchase of perfume, creams, and makeup. Cruz has been part of this Group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans come quickly without so much processing.
Her dream is for her child to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en: Tuty is 56 years old. She began her business, dealing with children's clothing, to support her now deceased husband. It was 16 years ago. They began with a small working capital and sold clothing in the street. Little by little with the passing of the time she developed her business. Tuty now sells in a local market. She knows how to deal well and manages with her business alone. Tuty has 2 sons. They are adults. She tries to help them by providing their family's with all necessary things. Now, she is going to buy children clothing for the new summer season and in this way to attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy children's clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new summer season

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, noodles, oil, etc. to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from buying and selling 'nipa', roofing and siding made of palm fronds.

Alicia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, noodles, oil, etc

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina lives in the village Agarak in Lori region. She graduated from Yerevan State Linguistic University, the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. Being very clever and a beloved teacher, she already has 35 years of pedagogical experience. She works at the village school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She also has pupils to whom she gives private classes, preparing them for the entrance examinations. Alina is married and she has a big family; three daughters and a son who is in the army for military service.
 
Alina is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, since the library of their village is poor and there are very few books of famous writers that pupils can take out for reading. The books that there are, are very old and worn out. The computer will be of great use for Alina. Through it her pupils will get acquainted with the famous masterpieces of  Russian Literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer to acquaint her pupils with masterpieces of Russian Literature

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica works hard to support her family. Angelica is single and has a food vending business in The Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angelica has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Angelica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Om- Jalal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Jalal. It consists of four women who are all hard-working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 120,000 YER. 

Baraka is 39 years old and a married woman with eight children. She is the leader of the group. She is an uneducated woman, but she knows her advantages very well. She has a strong determination to improve the standards of her living. She said she had a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Baraka invested that money in her own business. She started her business three years ago selling make up and accessories in order to help her husband with the expenses of the family. She sees this business as profitable for her. For further expansion, Baraka requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, make up, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

Baraka expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through selling more accessories, make up, and ready- made women's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, make up, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Soma is an energetic and enterprising woman of 37 years.  She is married, a housewife and a loving mother of two school-going children (one son and one daughter ). They are in grade 10 and grade 7 respectively. Soma is an Arts graduate and her husband Bhanjan, aged 39 years, has attended school up to grade 12.

Soma's husband is associated with a betel leaves business. He buys betel leaves from the wholesale market and supplies them to the local Pan Shops as well as selling them to their neighbors. Soma, though a housewife, contributes her efforts to help her husband. Betel leaves are locally known as 'PAN', and are a kind of mouth freshener, used especially in rural areas.  There is a great demand for betel leaves in their village. Thus, they have chosen this business.

Now Soma and her husband want to extend their business. Their customers are increasing day by day. Thus they decided to buy more betel leaves from the wholesale market. Soma asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy more betel leaves.  . She dreams of growing her business on a large scale. Besides that, her priority is to provide her children a good education so that they can be established in life.  She also hopes to earn additional revenue to give a decent lifestyle to her family.

She and her husband are grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase betel leaves for their existing business.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is married with twelve children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Armando is 48 years old and has five children who are in school. He has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Armando requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell. Armando has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Armando would like to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh raw food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava and raw bananas for the stall, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and raw bananas for the stall.

loans.name: Bangkok Group

texts.en:
Judith is a chairperson of Bangkok Group. She is in her early 30’s. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school, and another is still a baby. She has been running a grocery store selling beer, soft drinks, spirits, and she also manages a kitchen for barbecue (meat selling) in the same place. Judith has been in her business for 20 months, and now is able to make a good monthly profit.

She is requesting a first loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to improve her business by restocking drinks and meats for the barbecue service.  Judith dreams that one day she will be able to take her own loan to be flexible with her business.  She will share this loan with her loan group" BANGKOK" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery drinks and meat for her business.

loans.name: Julge

texts.en:
Julge is 42 years of age and a resident of Cangmohao, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married with two children. They are engaged in hog raising activities from which they earn a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Julge and her husband work hard selling their pigs at the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their pigs and piglets. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business.  They have requested from Paglaum MPC a 7,000 PHP loan.  They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Julge smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es: María tiene 26 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad y habita en casa de sus padres. María se gana la vida mediante el comercio de productos de tienda como: azúcar, frijoles, sal, golosinas, aceite, detergente, huevos, pan, etc. Tiene 5 años de contar con su tienda por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. María desea invertir en su negocio dado que desea satisfacer a un mayor número de clientes para lo cual necesita más mercadería. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un mayor inventario como: golosinas, frijoles, azúcar, sal, pan, aceite, huevos y de más artículos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: María is 26 and is a single mother to a 2-year-old boy. She lives in her parents' house. She makes a living selling basic items such as sugar, beans, salt, sweets, oil, detergent, eggs and bread. She has been running her shop for 5 years,  and so has gained a lot of experience, as well as customers who daily prefer to come to her shop. María wants to invest in her business so that she can satisfy a larger number of clients, and for this she needs more stock. This is why she is asking for a loan through FUSAI. She will invest it in buying a wider range of goods such as sweets, beans, sugar, salt, bread, oil and eggs, as well as other items requested by her clients.

loans.use: to buy items such as sweets, beans, sugar, salt, bread, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Kassipin

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 6 enfants, Kassipin est âgée de 52 ans et vit  avec son époux et ses enfants dans la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer sur ses études primaires, pour cela elle s’est basée sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans cette activité de fabrication de savons traditionnels. Elle  trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de 8 ans.  Après avoir pris des prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 7ème prêt  individuel et les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des fûts de déchets d’huile à Koutiala dans des usines, elle effectue sa fabrication à domicile  et sa vente à Bamako, à une clientèle  mixte au comptant.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Kassipin is married, the mother of 6 children, 52 years old and lives with her husband and children in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region.) For societal reasons, she did not have the opportunity to continue schooling past primary school, which is why she became engaged in running a small business when she was young, as her mother did. 

After having tried multiple businesses without success, Kassipin finally came upon the business of making traditional soaps. She has found that this business produces a fair income. In order to meet the needs of her many customers, and to expand the size of her business, Kassipin decided to partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso more than 8 years ago. After having been a part of group loans, all of which were fully repaid, Kassipin is on her 7th individual loan and has fully repaid all her previous loans as well.

With this loan, Kassipin plans to purchase barrels of oil in Koutiala in the factories. Her production is located in her home, and she sells the finished product in Bamako to a customer base made up of both men and women for cash. Kassipin hopes to earn an average monthly income of 100,000 francs CFA which she plans to use to pay back the loan and interest to Soro Yiriwaso, to provide for the daily expenses for her family, and to invest the rest back into other small revenue-generating businesses.

loans.use: to purchase oil for making soap

loans.name: Denny Genoveva

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Denny, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Denny es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los días, de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permitirle ganar algo para el bien de su hogar y también se entretiene en sus ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatillas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su vida y su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the Cristo Resucitado Credit Group meet in the community of Libertad #2 in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí and has been known for years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.  

This is where Denny lives; she is 54 years old, married, and has six adult children, two of whom still live at home.  Her husband is a driver. 

Denny is a homemaker who sells all kinds of clothing, high heels, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories) to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses.  She works almost every day for two to three hours a day; she sells her products on credit and collects every eight days.  She has had this business for over five years and it allows her to earn something for the good of her household and she also enjoys making her sales. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, and high heels.  She has been with her credit group from the start and she likes it because the loans help her a lot with her life and her business.  Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, and high heels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 15000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 22 year old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a tailoring business where she repairs and sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik lives in the village Getahovit in Tavush region. Martik for 20 years lived and worked in the Russian Federation with his family. He has a son who is in his last year of school. Finally being back to his motherland Martik decided to establish his own business. Now he has a small stone recycling workshop. Together with his business Martik also runs a farm with the help of his wife. In his farm he has 2 cows, a pig, 20 chickens and 4 beehives. His days and nights of hard work on his farm helps Martik to provide for his family their everyday needs. He also has a nice fruit garden from which he gathers a harvest of apples, plums, peaches and figs. The honey from his farm is very famous in the village and at the end of each season he has the purest and most healthful honey in his village. The sale of milk, different dairy-products, honey and eggs is also good income for them.
Martik asks this loan since he wants to enlarge his farming business and he wants to use the loan for the purchase of bulls and animal fodder.

loans.use: to enlarge his farming business he wants to use the loan to purchase bulls and animal fodder

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like spices, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Eva has been in this business for 30 years. In the future Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like spices, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung, 41, is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband does construction. Dung has been running a clothing shop for twenty-four years. She is the group leader of a nine-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the centre wearing a yellow blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Dung is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products of clothing to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different products of clothing to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 64 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been pig fattening for 46 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maryam Gader Group

texts.en:
This group is called Maryam Gader. It consists of four women members, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Maryam is a 53-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in a rented house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife in her home. Maryam is the leader of the group. Many years ago, Maryam purchased a bus for transportation. Over time, this bus has become very old and needs maintenance and repair. This transportation business is regarded as the sole income source of the family. Recently, it has stopped and because the bus needs repairing. This has created a bad condition and a financial crisis for the family. For this reason, Maryam applied for a loan of 80,000 YER in order to buy spare parts for the bus to maintain it.  

Maryam's vision is to purchase a piece of land and build her own house. She hopes to  save the money from renting and use it to improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the bus and do maintenance on it.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 38-year-old widow from Tbilisi city. She lives with her son, who is school-aged and doesn't have his own income. Marina is the only person who works hard to generate some income and does everything for her family's welfare. She works as a nurse and takes care of small children. Also, Marina has income from renting some rooms in her own house. Approximately, this income totals 550 GEL. However, this income isn't enough for Marina to make good living conditions and give her son a high education. She requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. Marina will repair her home and make it more comfortable for renting it at an increased price in the future. This will give her a chance to earn more income and create financial stability. With regards to the Start Up program, she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair her home and rent it at a good price.

loans.name: Ana Pastora

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, por quienes se esfuerzan día con día para brindarles estudios y todo lo necesario para que salgan adelante y cuenten con un mejor futuro. Desde hace varios años  que Ana se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Ana  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos y agujas, para poder atender mejor a sus clientes  y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras para poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Thirty-three-year-old Ana is a single mother living in her own home with her two children for whom she works day after day to offer them an education and everything they need to get ahead and have a better future.  For several years Ana has worked in tailoring and dressmaking, during which time she has gained a lot of experience, as well as steady customers.  She is a very responsible person who works with great care to give her best.  Ana is requesting a loan she can use to invest in her business by buying greater quantities of raw material, such as fabrics, buttons, thread, and needles, to be able to better serve her customers and not lose the opportunity to earn extra income so she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, thread, and needles wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbages, potatoes, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth de 37 años de edad tiene un negocio de copias y venta de útiles escolares ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de atender a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive con su madre en casa de ella, Ruth no posee hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para obtener mejores ingresos y así ella y su madre podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth is 37 and has a photocopying and school supply business that she runs from home. She has a lot of customers thanks to her range of goods, her fair prices and her good customer service. She uses her profits to cover various household costs. She lives with her mother in her mother's house. She doesn't have any children.

Ruth is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale goods so she can make a bigger profit. In this way, she and her mother will be able to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale goods.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina de 45 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos,  ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para ella lo más importante son los clientes ya que sabe que manteniéndolos satisfechos con el servicio que presta seguirán prefiriéndola y su negocio seguiría siempre activo. Ella ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Agustina lives with her life partner and their three children.  She is known for being an honest, hardworking, and above all very enterprising woman.  Several years ago she was able to set up a small convenience store in her home and thanks to God and her hard work and dedication, the business is very well known in the area and she has a large clientele.  For her, the most important thing is the customer, as she knows that if she keeps them satisfied with the service she offers they will keep preferring her and her business will continue to thrive.  She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in merchandise for the store, such as eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other products that will appeal to her customers.  In this way she hopes to achieve her dream of keeping her business thriving and thereby continuing to work toward a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other items

loans.name: Silvia Cristina

texts.es: Silvia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 5 años de edad, también tiene a su cuidado a su querida madre. Silvia tiene en su vivienda una pequeña tienda y vende golosinas, gaseosas, agua embolsada, fruta partida, pan francés, pan dulce, etc. El esposo de Silvia trabaja desde hace 6 años con una empresa constructora como jardinero. Silvia ha adquirido un crédito con FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava, hierro, ladrillo de obra para construir una habitación que actualmente (como se aprecia en la fotografía)es de madera.
texts.en: Thirthy-eight-year-old Silvia lives in her own home with her husband and her five-year-old son, and she also cares for her beloved mother.  Silvia has a small store in her home and she sells candy, soft drinks, bottled water, cut fruit, French bread, sweet bread, etc.  Silvia's husband has worked as a gardener for a construction company for six years.  Silvia has received a FUSAI loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick to build a room that is currently made of wood (as can be seen in the photograph).

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick to build a room

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn is 30 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa roofing in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell. Genelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling nipa roofing for three years and also earns an income from directly selling Avon products. Genelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Agriphina

texts.en:
Agriphina is 59 years old, a very well-established farmer who is situated in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya. She has been a practicing farmer for the past 30 years, and her primary income source is from selling cash crops, vegetables, fruit, milk, and eggs. She is passionate about farming as it gives her a lot of returns, while her greatest challenge is poor market conditions and diseases.

Agriphina says that she chose Juhudi Kilimo's KIVA loan because it will help her purchase a dairy goat for more milk production. This will boost her income and that will help in expanding her farm for future projects.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en: Johnstone is a 40-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as proactive. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita has had a variety store for 30 years. She is widowed and blessed with two children. Her older is married while the other one is engaged in a direct selling business. Despite her situation, Julita has been able to improve her business involvement. With her determination to improve her sales and income, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 30,000 allowing her to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, eggs and snack foods to sell. She believes that with her initiative, additional capital, and hard work, she will succeed.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods,  cooking oil, eggs and snack foods to restock her variety store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As the married parent of eight children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready to wear products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shorts, skirts, slippers, etc. to sell in her business buying and selling ready to wear products.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shorts, skirts, slippers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is a 37-year-old married man. He lives with his two children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years he and his wife have made aluminum products and operated a cafe in front of their house.

Nam would like a loan to purchase aluminum materials to make aluminum products and a quantity of beverages and coffee for his cafe. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers.

Nam also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his family's income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum materials to make aluminum products and a quantity of beverages and coffee for his cafe

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 55 años de edad y está casada, ellos viven en casa propia con sus dos hijos y un nieto de 16 meses. Gladys se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a comercializar pollos de engorde, su esposo es un pequeño ganadero. Gladys ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para sustituir la lámina averiada de las paredes y encementar el área de la cocina. Por lo que con el dinero comprará lámina galvanizada, clavos, cemento, arena, grava y pagará la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Gladys is 55 years old. She is married, and she and her husband live in their own home with two children and a grandson who is 16 months old. Gladys has been working for a long time selling broiler chickens. Her husband is a small farmer. 

Gladys has requested a loan from FUSAI to replace the broken sheet metal of the walls and to cement the kitchen area. With this money, she will buy galvanized sheet metal, nails, cement, sand, and gravel, and also use it to pay for labor.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheet metal, nails, cement, sand, and gravel, so that she can renovate the walls of her home and cement the kitchen area.

loans.name: Angelica Yamilleth

texts.es: Angélica de 38 años de edad es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos (de 15 y 13 años de edad) los tuvo con su ex compañero de vida y con su actual esposo tiene uno de 3 años de edad. Angélica y su esposo han adquirido un terreno que actualmente lo están pagando, en este terreno han levantado una pequeña champa (vivienda improvisada con materiales de lámina, madera y otros), pero ambos están trabajando duro para salir adelante. Angélica trabaja en una escuela pública cuyas labores consiste en hacer la limpieza mañana y tarde. El esposo de Angélica es un albañil que actualmente trabaja en un proyecto de construcción fuera del municipio de donde habita, regresando a casa cada 15 días. Angélica se ha acercado a FUSAI para adquirir un crédito y con el dinero comprar lámina galvanizada y madera para ampliar con una habitación más, también comprará cemento, arena y grava para pavimentar el suelo. Espera lo antes posible realizar estas obras; Angélica está consciente del compromiso que está adquiriendo, su esposo la está apoyando.
texts.en:
Angélica is 38 years old, and she is the mother of three children, two of whom (15 and 13 years old) she had with her former partner. With her current husband, she has a 3-year-old. Angélica and her husband have acquired a plot of land that they are currently paying for. On this land, they have put up a small shelter, which has been improvised with sheet metal, wood, and other materials. Both of them are working hard to get ahead. 

Angélica works at a public school doing the morning and afternoon cleaning. Her husband is a carpenter who is currently working on a construction project out of town, and he comes home every 15 days. 

Angélica has approached FUSAI to acquire a loan, and with this money, she will buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to build one more room for her home. She will also buy cement, sand, and gravel to pave the floor. Angélica wants to make these improvements as soon as possible. She is aware of the commitment she is making, and her husband is helping her.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to build a new room. She will also buy cement, sand, and gravel to pave the floor.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de hamacas  desde hace 30 años, y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder elaborar un buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su familia logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos y nailon de colores para seguir elaborando mas hamacas y asi poder obtener empores ganancias y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old, and she lives in her home house with her life partner and four children. Maria has been making and selling hammocks for 30 years, and this has given her the experience necessary to be able to do a good job. 

With Maria's sales and support from her family, they manage to stay on top of their household expenses. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase thread and colored nylon to keep making hammocks. This way, she'll be able to improve her earnings and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: buy thread and colored nylon.

loans.name: Oscar Tomas

texts.es: Oscar Tomas mayor de edad casado con cinco hijos todos independientes, originario del municipio de Chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio, ubicado en el occidente del país, Oscar es una microempresario que se dedica a múltiples actividades como: venta de servicios eléctricos, fontanería, carpintería, pintura y otros es reconocido en el ramo, contando con clientes fijos y eventuales ofreciendo sus servicios a empresas privadas y publicas como a comerciantes entre otros uno de sus sueños es poder seguir mejorando sus herramientas y continuar creciendo en su negocio, El objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para compra de herramientas manuales como: alambres, clavos de acero, pinzas, entre otros garantizando los óptimos equipos, para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Oscar Tomas agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Oscar Tomas is an older gentleman who has five grown children.  He is from the municipality of Chinandega, a zone in the western part of the country where a lot of commerce takes place.  He is a small businessman who is involved in a variety of activities, such as electrical work, plumbing, carpentry and painting.  He is well-known in his field, and he has a lot of regular customers.  He also works with clients who only need his services occasionally.  He offers his services to public and private businesses, such as merchants.  

One of his dreams his to have better tools and to continue to grow his business.  The purpose of this new loan is  to purchase hand tools such as wires, clips, steel nails and other items.  If he can guarantee that he has the best equipment, he can offer better service to his clients. He is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are able to offer to people who do not have a lot of financial resources.

loans.use: to purchase hand tools such as wires, clips, steel nails and wrenches.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella posee una librería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para surtir aun mas y poder atender mejor a su cliente y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The borrower is 26 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and her children.  She has a bookshop, which is located in her home.  She has many customers due to the quality and good price of her products.  She is requesting a loan to purchase additional wholesale merchandise to stock up even further, and be able to provide better service to her customers. In this way, she will earn higher profits, and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Raul Santos

texts.es:
Raul tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito de los Aquijes y es padre de 3 hijos a quienes quiere mucho; Raul es un hombre muy trabajador, el labora como empleado en un colegio de su ciudad y de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Raul esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su hogar y poder comprar enseres para su vivienda, asi podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Raul is 55, he lives in the district of los Aquijes and is the father of 3 children who he loves very much. Raul is a very hard working man, he works as an employee at a school in his city and in this way is able to have income allowing him to make progress and settle the expenses of his home.
Raul is grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered him he will be able to improve his home and purchase furniture for his residence. This way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working to make his big dream come true, to own his own business.

loans.use: with the improvement of his residence and the purchase of furniture

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Ma. Luna has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nipa roofing to sell
